reviews.reviewText: Just received this new coffee grinder to replace the one we've had for years. I was concerned when I opened it because it doesn't appear to be a deep even though it advertised a "large capacity". However, I was very happy when grinding coffee for the first time. It handled the whole beans just fine, ground even faster than our previous model, and it was quite a bit quieter. I am glad this is the grinder we chose!

reviews.reviewTitle: It's more than a coffee grinder for me!
reviews.reviewText: I ordered this product a while ago, but started to use it recently. The surprising thing is that this little grinder is working perfectly as a versatile spice grinder for my kitchen. I used it to grinder dried red pepper, black pepper, ginger, chili pepper, crispy shrimp or even peanuts when I needed some delicious powder. I used a new toothbrush instead of the little cleaning brush with the grinder though. The price is quite good as well.

reviews.reviewTitle: Makes extreme fast work of coffee beans.
reviews.reviewText:
Makes extreme fast work of coffee beans. I had to throw my last grinder away when I realized how bad it was after using the Mueller. If you want coarse beans it only takes a few seconds, but it doesn't take much longer for a fine grind. Noise level is low and clean up is easy. Does not have an auto selection for the grind at least not on this model, but as fast as it works it doesn't really need one.
10/4/2019 Update. Still working good.

I use this grinder to make coffee each day and am super impressed by the output of this little machine. It is a tiny workhorse and gets the coffee beans to the right consistency for use in a french press. I have used this to make a finer raw sugar powder and it also did the job. It is a tiny bit hard to clean, but without having too many detachable parts the only piece that can be completely washed in the dishwasher is the lid. So far wiping out the inside between uses is working all right.

reviews.reviewTitle: bought this 2 months ago now, and still loving it!
reviews.reviewText: I have only ever had pre-ground coffee, and OH MAN! Fresh ground is a revelation! It is SO GOOD! Anyway, this product has been a champ through every day use. I'm absolutely ADDICTED to fresh ground coffee, now, so it's safe to say, it has taken a beating these last 2 months, and is still kicking like a champ! It looks like a cheap plastic hunk of future junk, but it is so efficient at grinding coffee evenly and fine. I've never had such a fine ground coffee, and it's been great. Hope it continues to work. Will be back to update if and when it breaks down.

lemme tell y'all it GRINDS. so good like I've never seen. my 'coffee beans' are practically dust & that's how I like it y'all. I highly recommend for all those coffee drinkers out there. quite the lil machine

Noise- it’s a grinder so it will make some noise. I don’t trust a grinder that doesn’t make noise.
Easy to clean-easy as in there’s only two parts to clean, but you have to be careful. Not an issue though.
Overall-cheap and gets the job done. Debated purchasing a more expensive product bc I felt it might be more reliable, however this cheaper priced item has shown to be reliable. I don’t overload the grinder, I take my time in grinding the coffee beans and I take the time to take care of my product. So far no issues to report, so overall a good investment.

reviews.reviewTitle: This product is easy to use, price is very reasonable.
reviews.reviewText: I bought this product because I had coffee beans to grind.

We've used a Krups grinder for years and decided to give the Mueller a try and very glad we dd. I think the less powerful motor on the Mueller along with the blade design and shape of the stainless container (bowl) all contribute the the Mueller's ability to produce a very consistent grind without to much fine powder resulting in much less bitterness. It is very easy to know when the grind is complete by just listening to the sound coming from the Mueller.

We make 12 cups of coffee each morning in a Cuisinart drip coffee maker which requires 5/8 cup of grounds for our taste. The Mueller makes it easy to grind this quantity of beans. When the grind is complete we simply turn the Mueller upside down and gently tap on the bottom side a couple times then, while inverted, remove the clear plastic lid and pour the ground coffee into the filter.

We could not be more pleased with a coffee bean grinder and highly recommend the Mueller.

Disclaimer: This is my first purchase EVER for a coffee bean grinder. I don't have anything to compare this to and I am solely rating this product on how well it suited my desire which was to grind coffee beans.

Given the disclaimer above, the product is very very good for what it is. It looks very unassuming but it gets the job done. In 9 seconds and a rather quiet manner, it grinds coffee beans evenly and neatly. Even better, the device is easy to clean without having to disassemble the whole thing at all. My advice would be to buy a small rag that you can dampen and re-use to avoid wasting paper towels. At the end of the day, it's a simple, no frills device that did what I wanted it to do: grind coffee beans & easy clean

reviews.reviewTitle: It works great. You can feel and hear the quality
reviews.reviewText: I use for grinding flax seeds. It works great. You can feel and hear the quality.

There has been only a few weeks since I got this grinder and I am really happy with this purchase. I needed it to grind chia seeds and it does a perfect job. It gets it to the level I want in less than 10seconds, or in 2-3 pushes down, and for such a short time, I do not mind the noise, although to be fair it is not high. I tried it with pumpkin seeds, almonds and cashew nuts. Every time, I was happy with the result. I have not tried it for coffee beans but for the nuts it provides a very fine grind, so I think it would be good even for Turkish coffee. My previous grinder was a Tchibo made in Switzerland, which lasted for more than 20 years. Since I could not find the same grinder on Amazon or from any other seller, I was looking to buy one that was designed and produced in EU. This one is made in China, and I would have preferred it being made in EU, but still this grinder seem to be a good quality overall and so far I am glad with my choice. I like it also because it is white color. All American brands I could find on amazon were black. I do not know how long it will last, but for the price it is a good product.

reviews.reviewTitle: NOT for seeds/nuts/spices! (But I use it for them anyway)
reviews.reviewText:
First thing I feel obligated to mention is that this listing is a bit misleading. In the description it indicates this coffee grinder can be used for items other than coffee beans, however as you will see the instruction manual clearly states that this should only be used for coffee beans.

That having been said, I used it for chia seeds anyway. For the price, I am honestly not too bothered if it does some kind of irreparable harm to my grinder - I wanted chia pudding and no grinder instruction manual was going to get in my way.

I have now used this grinder with both chia seeds and coffee beans. I'm not a grinder aficionado and I don't need the fanciest product on the market. This grinder gets the job done and provides a nice fine grind, just what I was looking for. The motor sounds powerful, but is relatively quiet compared to other grinders I have used (it's still loud, but not AS loud)

Overall I am pleased with my purchase, I have not had this product long so I cannot attest to how long it lasts but so far, so good. It's a good price and I think a better option than some others out there in the same price bracket.

reviews.reviewTitle: Very nice design and not heavy
reviews.reviewText: Very nice design and not heavy. Large capacity ! For Great Price I got what I am looking for, Just in a 15 seconds my coffee beans ready for French Press! Would highly recommend this product. Maybe just more color varieties.....))

reviews.reviewTitle: Quick and easy coffee bean grinding
reviews.reviewText: This is my first bean grinder. Recently on a trip to visit my son in NYC, he explained to me the benefits/joy of cold brewed coffee. Since I am a newbie and experimenting with different coffees I thought the best way would be to grind my own fresh beans. I picked this grinder based on the reviews and they were spot on. The manual gives all the technical info (how to use) but also includes a nice chart concerning how much and how long to grind, quantity of beans to use, and ratio of ground coffee to water. Grind your beans, wipe out the grinder, and enjoy your coffee!

It was as described. It is very easy to use. I have only used it today but it came highly recommended. It states you can measure the ground coffee from the inside but I tip it upside down into the clear top and scoop it from the top. There are measurements for whole beans and what they grind down too for an idea of the amount to use which makes it easy for coffee amounts.

I bought this grinder for grinding homemade herbs etc. It works like a charm and is easy to clean. While there are reviews that says this grinder is just for coffee as stated in the booklet however it is explained that this is so other flavors do not get mixed in the coffee.. It can be used for other things other than coffee. I would recommend a separate grinder for coffee and herbs. This grinder works well for everything I have used it for so far, dried garlic, dried onions, dried tomato and nut! Very good quality, quiet and powerful! I would highly recommend.
Simple design, grinds evenly, pretty easy to clean. The description says it can also grind other foods, but the product instructions advise against grinding anything but coffee beans

reviews.reviewTitle: Save Your Money and Look Elsewhere
reviews.reviewText: Please see pictures. Like another one star reviewer, I had coffee grounds get in the motor upon the first use (literally straight from the box defective). As you can see based on the second picture, the inner cup was not sealed/flush with the upper plastic chamber. Reviewed coffee grinders extensively on Amazon and this was the highest rated grinder, save manual burr grinders. Very disappointed - likely better off getting an extended warranty on one that grinds effectively but is prone to motor failure.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great repacement for the discontiued Braun KSM2

But wait, I just discovered and purchased this Mueller MEC1105 grinder which is almost exactly the same as my favorite AND only costs $19 AND works just as good. Thank you Mueller!

Oh and I arrived a day early to boot.

reviews.reviewTitle: A basic but solid coffee grinder
reviews.reviewText:
Like the title says, this is a pretty basic coffee grinder, but it's solidly built and delivers good results. I'll be comparing it to the Mr Coffee IDS77-RB, since I've used that one for several years.

-- Build: Good weight to it, the plastic is reasonably thick and doesn't feel as cheap like other grinders I've used (including the Mr Coffee). I get the impression this thing is going to hold up well. I'm not sure how well the white color is going to hold up to coffee stains though.

-- Features: It has a removable lid that doubles as a cup and a on/off button. That's it. That said, basic guidelines are laid out in the directions, which are pretty well written. It may take you a couple batches to get an exact time down. The Mr Coffee grinder had more features like cups & coarseness settings, and a removable grind chamber that I wish this one had, but they're not a deal breaker. The power cord on this one is a generous 39" (or 1 meter since it's Austrian) which is a lot more than any other coffee grinder I've had. The Mr Coffee has a frustratingly short cord, maybe 24".

-- Operation: The on button is a little stiff, but the grinder actually runs relatively quiet for what it is. My old Mr. Coffee grinder had a ear piercing note to it that was the last thing you'd want to hear in the morning. This one, not so bad. To empty it out, you have to turn over the entire grinder and then pull out the lid/cup.

-- Grind: Grind is more even than any other blade style coffee grinder I've used, although it's still not as good as a burr grinder. It's also a lot cheaper than a burr grinder though. The coffee I made with it is pretty smooth, although not as strong as I'm used to. I think that's more down to me not having the grind time down yet.

Full disclosure: I received a free sample of this product for evaluation; however, this review represents my honest opinion.

reviews.reviewTitle: How can they sell a product like that? I will throw it out anyway and ...
reviews.reviewText: Coffee grinds got inside the motor underneath where beans go and started coming out from the air vents on the bottom of the machine. How in the heck could this happen? I believe the blade was not screwed down far enough and left a gap to allow the coffee grounds to get through. I will unscrew the 3 screws on bottom to see if I can hold back something internally to tighten the blade. How can they sell a product like that? I will throw it out anyway and continue using my Krups grinder that's the same size and has been working great for years. German name but made in china, I guess that says it all !!! Update: Blade was tight already, could not tighten more. This was the first product I bought from amazon that was defective. Next time I'll stay with a brand I trust. If this happens to anyone else, please don't hesitate to post it here

reviews.reviewTitle: Highly Deffective. Poorly Manufactured. Don't Buy.
reviews.reviewText: Got this about a month ago. First time I tried to turn it on, it wouldn't work. Upon further inspection I realized the blade wasn't mounted in the center of the bowl. Literally had to bend it so that the blade wouldn't catch on the side wall. Additionally, coffee grinds easily get into the push button mechanism and cause it to get stuck and keep running even when your not pressing the button. It's incredibly loud. Very displeased with this and won't be purchasing anything from this manufacturer again.

I bought this because it advertises as grinding nuts as well as coffee beans, and I do both. I have owned it 16 hours. It ground up coffee beans fine. When I put nuts in, it started, but quickly sputtered and even smoked, I heard a pop and that was that. I thought maybe it got stressed/heated but I started it again a few hours later and it would not turn on so it's throw it out time. So folks know I wasn't abusing it, I have had the $19.95 Krups basic grinder for a year and it's done absolutely well for me, but one of the plastic knobs went so I looked to improve on what I first purchased. I will say that this was cheap enough that returning it is almost probably not worth it, but still if you advertise it to do something it should not fail like it did.

I bought this for my mom as a gift and she loves it. It’s really easy to use, has a good amount of storage for the coffee beans, and it grinds then quickly. She hasn’t had any complaints and has been using it almost every day for the past month. I would highly recommend :)

reviews.reviewTitle: Great coffee grinder for small counter
reviews.reviewText: I had a Braun coffee grinder that I bought in the 1990s. It finally died, only because I dropped it. Found this as a replacement. Works great, easy to use just like my old Braun. I use it every day. Only complaint: My Braun had a place to wind the cord onto when you weren't using it. This Mueller does not. Not a big deal, just wanted to point it out.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great for Grinding My Flax Seeds
reviews.reviewText: I mulled over which grinder to buy and I finally decided on this one. I needed an efficient grinder for turning my Flax Seeds in to a powder. I wondered if it would work since it was designed for larger coffee beans and not tiny seeds. Well it worked like a charm. I am so happy with Mueller Electric Coffee Grinder. And to top it off it's easy to clean. Instead of buying a brush made for cleaning out grinders, I decided to buy a $3.00 make up brush to do the job. Five stars from me!!!

I got this for my mother for Christmas since our stores have removed their coffee grinders. She loves the convenience of this product, as well the aroma of the freshly ground coffee.
The grinder is relatively quiet and grinds pretty consistently.

Nice compact size in a powerful little grinder. Great little machine, can grind your coffee beans in 30 seconds or less!

Mueller HyperGrind Precision Electric Coffee Grinder Mill with Large Grinding Capacity and HD Motor also for Spices, Herbs, Nuts, Grains and More

I am quite happy with this coffee grinder, which seems like a precision instrument. I am hopeful that the sharpness of the blade and intricate cutting action may indicate that it is indeed Mueller time.

The wife decided that we were enough coffee addicts that is was time to start grinding our own beans. So she bought a hand crank thingee. My first morning back from a long and jet lagged trip abroad I stumbled downstairs and tried to brew myself something, but first I had to turn the handle on the thing like 100 times. It was long from there until I was up on Amazon looking at reviews of electric coffee grinders.

This one works well, is simple to use, and makes quick work of the beans. I am happy with it. The minus one-star is because it is noisy. I specifically read the reviews looking for one that was quiet (which was the wife's argument in favor of the hand crank, as we have sleeping kids in the house in the early morning). When I saw a mention in a review that this was quiet I hit the buy button. But I don't know what the "quiet reviewer" was listening to (or maybe had noise-cancelling earplugs on?). It is hard for me to see how anyone could view the Mueller's loud and high-pitched noise as anything other than noisy. So, caveat emptor. Otherwise seems like a great little made in Austria machine.

Not a paid review. Even grind, solid product. I replaced a Krups coffee grinder with this one. Found this one to be slightly better in my opinion. I always had to pick up and shake the Krups while it was grinding to make sure it ground all the contents evenly. This one does that while sitting on the countertop. Also perhaps very slightly quieter, although not by much.

reviews.reviewTitle: ... coffee grinder in 40 years and it is the best ever. My past coffee grinders sounded like a ...

My past coffee grinders sounded like a propeller plane taking off and the nose was so loud and irritating that I had to warn my wife in the next room each morning before I began to grind to cover her ears. The Mueller grinds faster, quieter and more efficient than any of my past two grinders; and, I expect it to outlast me.

To my surprise, this is extremely quiet and performs as expected. I can’t rightfully compare it since this is the first one I’ve ever owned. But I would highly recommend this for sure.

reviews.reviewTitle: Now....how do I effectively get the coffee out?
reviews.reviewText: You'd think by now they'd have come up with a clever way to remove the coffee grounds once they're ground, but you'd be sadly disappointed. They recommend you use a spoon to "spoon" it out around the blades which is utterly retarded, and takes forever, and still doesn't get all the coffee out. So, what I do after grinding is turn the stupid thing upside down and bump the button a few times to get the coffee into the lid, which I then dump into another cup for storage. The grinder works great, but then it turns into a cluster**** after that, so....heads up.
