Wow! A coffee grinder has been on my Wish List for quite a while and I finally treated myself. I don’t drink coffee, but want to grind spices for cooking. I also grind oats to add to my dog’s shampoo for itchy skin. Nearly all basic coffee grinders I’ve encountered look and function the same - steel inner bowl, small blade, clear lid with depresser button to begin the grind. This grinder is the same, but I will say it is MUCH quieter and seemingly a bit faster than others I’ve used elsewhere. I appreciate that it is an Austrian product. The steel bowl seems to have a non-stick coating of sorts because the spices and oatmeal I have ground came right out with a few taps, rather needing to scoop and scrape. In the video you’ll see how quickly the grinder turned rolled oats into oat flour for my dog’s bath. I wasn’t expecting it to get such a fine powder and was quite impressed with that. I’ve also ground cumin seeds and peppercorns with great success, which elevated my cooking.
I’m really glad I treated myself and bought this coffee grinder!

I live in an RV, therefore the small footprint of the grinder is ideal. Cleaning the clear housing (top part) is easy—a little soapy water. Cleaning the base must be done by hand. I usually just wipe it out with a paper towel.

It’s not dummy proof. That is, my old grinder had a dial I turned to set the level of coarseness. So when I needed coarse ground beans for the percolator, I would set the dial, turn on the machine, and when the hopper was full, my work was done, and I had perfectly ground beans, suited for my machine, with no effort. And no brain power.

Not so with the Mueller. Coarseness (or fineness) of the coffee is determined by how long the user grinds the beans. So you have to learn by trial and error how long to grind your beans to suit your machine. The product comes with a printed guide, but I was disappointed. I’m constantly pulsing then stopping to check the coarseness of the beans. Annoying.

I gave it 5 stars for durability because I’m an optimist. I’ve owned it for about a month and it’s still working. Let’s hope it lasts a year. I’ve gone through two leaky drip coffee makers in 18 months. It would be a nice change to have this little machine last longer than those two lemons.

This grinder sounded and worked perfectly the 1st 1/2 cup of roasted coffeebeans it ground.
Within a few seconds of the 2d use, the grinder stopped grinding never to work again.
I purchased this coffee grinder to replace my inexpensive 20 year old multi-use grinder that decided to retire. I used it to grind coffeebeans and the almonds I put in an exfoliating soap I used to make.
I chose the Mueller brand as I know it to be a trusted name in quality.
Imagine my dismay to learn this grinder was made in the People's Republic of China.
Additionally, contrary to Amazon's description of this grinder's multi-use capability, the Mueller instruction booklet states "only for use to grind roasted coffee beans".
Misleading descriptions are occurring much too often.
Needless to say, it's being returned.

I really don’t have a lot of good things to say about this coffee grinder other than I regret buying it.

1. It’s impossible to clean. The area where the coffee gets grounded doesn’t detach, to clean this well you need to wipe it with a wet towel to get at the crevices and then go at it with a qtip

2. It doesn’t have any presets for how fine/coarse you want your coffee. You just hold it down and COUNT, or just eyeball when to stop. Needless to say, your coffee beans will come out differently every time.

I’m giving it 3 starts bc it’s not totally useless, it does grind coffee, just it’s not a good coffee grinder.
I liked how easy this product was to use, but after the 4th round of grinding beans, it stopped and will not grind anymore. I was unable to finish even 1 bag of beans. Over the course of a week.
Purchased at the end of July and no longer working by the middle of September. I knew it wouldn't last forever but didn't expect this!
It’s not durable coffee grounder . It did not last for long for me. Hard to clean. I’m not recommending this product. I ordered a new one already.

reviews.reviewTitle: Coffee Only Grinder! Motor burnt out within 1 minute of use on soft nuts.
reviews.reviewText:
I bought this grinder because it's Amazon product description listed it as being useful on "Spices, Herbs, Nuts, Grains and More" as well as coffee beans. But when I unwrapped the product at home the manual explicitly stated it was only to be used on coffee beans. I cannot vouch for how well it grinds coffee beans, because I risked putting in some macadamia nuts to grind, and within a minute of partial use the motor stopped and smoke came out of the device.

As long as this product is listed on Amazon as being suitable for "Spices, Herbs, Nuts, Grains and More" I will continue to list it as a 1 star product.

Is my coffee bean grinder broken or is this really the worst grinder ever made?
The blade actually works really well
But 1/3 of the ground coffee just falls into the inside of the machine... like below the grinder. And then little grinds just fall out the bottom, but not a lot, just enough to feel it when you’re walking barefoot in your kitchen

I normally buy ground coffee but I was gifted some coffee beans and needed to get a grinder. This one had good reviews and was marked as a best seller so I went with it. It just arrived this morning and I used it first thing. I wiped it down with a wet cloth, as instructed, and didn't notice right away that the metal portion wasn't flush with the rest of the grinder. After using it, I noticed there were coffee grounds on the counter under where the grinder was sitting. It was when I was trying to wipe the grounds out that I saw the big gap that they could fall into. Shaking the grinder, you can hear coffee grounds moving around inside. Definitely returning this.

Have only had for a week so can not comment on durability but seems well made.
Attractive unit. Easily grinds a full 1/2 cup of beans to a coarse grind in just a
couple quick runs of the mill. Exact amount of coffee for my 32oz French Press.

reviews.reviewTitle: I'm a Bear Till I've Had My Coffee
reviews.reviewText: Had a delicious cup of coffee this morning from my own freshly ground beans. Seven seconds was all it took to grind the beans for my French press. Couldn't have been easier!

I've used it for grains, seeds, and nuts.

Works exactly how you would expect. Good quality.

I shake it a little while grinding and I'm able to make flour out of grains and seeds for real bread.

Update:
I attempted to puree some dried fruit (which included some VERY hard, dried apricots) and the machine went for a little and then stopped working. I guess that is it's limit. If you plan on using dried fruit, I suggest slightly re-hydrating them prior.
I am not taking off a star because I believe this is truly a great grinder considering it worked so well making flour and is at a fair price.

The grinder does what it is supposed to. It has a quiet and smooth even grind. The issue with this grinder is the mess. Coffee grounds always end up everywhere when removing the lid to pour the grounds into the coffee maker. The other way to avoid this is to grind small amount at a time and address them little by little to the coffee maker. I'll be going back to Me Coffee which has a removeable grind cup with flip up lid.

This little beauty is AMAZING! It will grind the entire reservoir of coffee to a beautiful silky powder(if that's what you want, it's up to you) in less than 20 seconds. Every little bit gets ground, there are no little chunks left behind. After a few uses you can tell from the sound when it's done. There's no static and it pours out cleanly.
Does its job to grind coffee beans evenly. Ground coffee does stick a bit in grinder but that happens with all grinders like this and you just tap it out. Reliable and not too noisy.
We had a Kruups food grinder and decided to try something new. This product received a lot of positive feedback and I'm glad I bought this. Quiet. Grinds quickly and very easy to clean

Was excited to finally get a new coffee grinder. I hate using the premade pods but our old grinder went out and we weren't sure what one to get so we kept putting it off. Finally decided it was time after spending another $30 on coffee pods. Have to say I'm kinda disappointed in this grinder. It doesn't have any way for you to get the grounds out without them going all over the counter and for some reason they seem to static cling to everything, it doesn't really hold a whole lot of beans to grind at once, and it is still pretty noisy. At least with the Mr. Coffee grinder I had before the ground up coffee all made it into the coffee maker so at least it made up for the cruddy noise it made. Wish husband hadn't thrown out the box because I would honestly rather return this one and spend a bit more on a better grinder.

Shame on me for not reading the other reviews first!!! I bought it last August, never used. Opened last night to grind coriander seed - what a terrible terrible job it did, completely inadequate. I'm a chef and need it for my work. Yeah Its really quiet, yeah but its quiet cause it doesnt work! Also I feel kind of duped, since the name on the product says 'Mueller Austria' I thought it was made in Austria. Theres nothing on the description that indicates otherwise. When I got the product it is of course, Made In China like everything else. So I'm really disappointed. Wish I could return it!

Purchased this grinder to replace one from a different brand that I had for about one year before it decided to stop grinding. So far, I'm very pleased with this grinder. The price was definitely in my 'ballpark' and it's easy to use because I can control the grind manually to the coarseness I want. The cover is clear so I can watch as I grind. Noise level is irrelevant to me but I do not find this grinder to be overly loud. My only complaint is it grinds a small amount at a time, but realistically, I don't need it to grind more, I just want it to because I'm a bit lazy and don't grind on a daily basis.
All in all, I'm very pleased with the purchase.
Love it! Fast,not too loud ,and grinds coffee beans evenly . So now fresh,good espresso every morning

reviews.reviewTitle: Burr grind is overrated. Get this.
reviews.reviewText: I used to use only Burr grinders. They are expensive. They break. I started to use hand grinders. After a few months of that chore I decided to give this one a try because of the price and number of good reviews. Its great. The coffee does not taste bitter as otherwise suggested by others. Its quick and easy to use. A little bit of a pain to clean. The coffee grinds tends to stick sometimes beneath the blades.

Let me start by saying I have never owned a coffee grinder before. I don’t know how this compares exactly to other brands but I will tell you my experience with it. It grinds coffee beans quickly and uniformly, about 10 seconds for one scoop of beans. It’s not too loud, and you only have to grind for a few seconds anyway. For me, transferring the ground coffee into the coffee filter is a bit messy. Every time the top lid is is put on or off, fragments tend to go everywhere. Also, the coffee doesn’t all just fall out when emptying into the filter, I have to wipe it out with my finger to get a pretty good amount of it to come out (probably due to static). Would probably be better if you used a small wooden basting brush for this. Again, I don’t know if this is a problem for all grinders, but it is quite annoying in this unit. I’ve taken to only using it on top of a dish towel by my coffee maker to mitigate the mess. One time when I was trying to see if I was using it wrong, I flipped the unit over and tried to use the clear top to transfer the coffee to my filter, using the top as a cup. I LIGHTLY tapped the clear plastic onto my plastic coffee filter and a small piece of the clear plastic chipped off. Fortunately it was just small enough that everything still works, but I wouldn’t expect the plastic to be that cheaply made. Overall this grinder suits my needs but doesn’t seem to be designed perfectly well

I rarely leave negative reviews, but this grinder is the most worthless appliance I've ever purchased. I had it for 2 months and used it three times before the motor burned out. I grind 12 oz. of coffee beans at a time and it died after less than 36 oz of coffee beans--ridiculous! I recommend looking at different brands.

Ex-barista here, not a fan. Inconsistent grind, a few pulses got me half chunk beans mixed in with semi-coarse and some fine grit. Replacing with a slightly more expensive burr grinder that will give consistency. This is probably good for small amounts spices and such, not really coffee... unless it's a single cups worth of fine grind I suppose.

This is my first coffee grinder. It's very easy to use and small enough to store away in the cupboard. The only thing I don't like about it is how the finer coffee grinds stick to the inside. I didn't want to wash it every day so I just use a small towel to wipe out the inside before storing it. Other than that, I love it.

reviews.reviewTitle: Grinds great but how do you clean it?
reviews.reviewText: How does one clean this? It has no settings so grind away until your happy with consistency. It’s a bit loud, but I’m happy.

reviews.reviewTitle: Stable base to prevent tipping over
reviews.reviewText: Nice, sleek design but the blades could be lowered a tad in the grinding bowl. I like the nice, wide base for added stability in preventing pod the grinder tipping over.

Just ordered this coffee grinder and received it a week ago. It's small and easy to store in our cabinets, and grinds coffee beans quickly and efficiently. We have noticed a positive difference between the grounds using this grinder versus our last one. It is also simple and easy to use, you just push down on the black button when the lid is on and closed, and this activates the blades. You can quickly grind coffee beans in 10 seconds or less, depending on how finely you like it. Definitely happy with this purchase and would recommend this to anyone!

reviews.reviewTitle: The Grinder has a leak from the top.
reviews.reviewText:
The Grinder has a leak from the top. After bout 10 time use it stopped working. So, we opened the bottom cover (three screws) , we found a lot of coffee stuck in there. Cleaned it up, carefully put it back on - no problem ever since

OK product but poor workmanship. Review updated from 1 star to 4

Great value for the price. I use this one for my nuts. The coffee grinder I have is over 10 years. But at today's price for that same unit was a Wow to me! Expensive! So I tried this unit. I like the soft sound, the ease of cleaning, and the efficiency of the grind. This is not a product I use daily. But I am happy with it each time I grind nuts for a smoothie, or to add to my baked goods. Enjoy.

I bought this to grind flax seed which I use about two tablespoonfuls each day. My old grinder lasted twenty plus years but had parts rattling around inside, so I bought this Mueller. It was quieter, didn't spin as fast, and didn't grind near as fast or fine. I could have lived with that, but it suddenly, completely died after two weeks. I ground only small batches, and never for very long, maybe twenty seconds. I'm pitching it in the trash because it won't be worth the hassle to return it. Don't waste your money on this junk!

I can just pour in a little less than 1/2 Cup of coffee beans (or flax seeds, etc.) and slid the lid on, then lightly push down on the front button on the lid, and it easily grinds up the items. No sliding on and turn the base cup, and then sliding on and turning the lid, like my last grinder. This one cleans easily, too. There is still some grinding noise, but it's not bad. It's small enough it stores well in my cupboard until I'm ready to use it. I'm pleased with this great little grinder.

I'm a coffee roaster - World Coffee Company here in Oregon. I have a lot of sophisticated equipment to both roast and prepare coffee. I travel frequently. and I had a rather extensive trip planned to Thailand and China over the past 6 weeks. On my previous trip I brought a hand grinder. It became painfully obvious that this method takes way too long, especially for the amount of coffee I prepare . On the recent trip, I purchased the Mueller electric mill. My goal was to get the lightest, most compact grinder I could find since I would be packing it. I also had my Hario 4 cup dripper , filters, and lots of fresh roasted coffee beans.
The Muelller does a great job of grinding. Since I prepare pour over, it took some experimentation to get the grind right. If you just grind the beans in a normal fashion, for example, for 15-20 seconds, the coffee will be fine for espresso but too powdery for pour over. I ended up using a "start - stop" method in order to get exactly what I needed. I would grind sporadically for a few seconds, stop, and then grind some more. This way I was able to control the consistency and get it to where it needed to be.
In short, I ended up leaving it as a gift for one of my customers and I just ordered another one. You can't go wrong with this grinder.

Just received it, and did a grind of some whole coffee beans. Nice, even grind. It's a bit fatter than the 37-year-old Krups I'm replacing. (Motor and blades are still fine on that, but the lid is badly chipped after all these years!) The Mueller would fit a man's hand well. A wee bit fiddly to clean. But the beans are new, so may be a bit oilier and stickier than usual. Logged onto Mueller's website to warranty-register, and got a very friendly response back within an hour. So far, so good!

reviews.reviewTitle: grinds fast, but inconsistent, makes a mess, hard to clean
reviews.reviewText:
Powerful motor does grind fast, but I often end up with a fine grind that still has whole or nearly-whole beans in it.

Cleaning? Ha! The area with the blades does NOT come out, so there's no way to clean it well.

Getting the coffee out after grinding it is a mess - I turn the whole thing upside down and bang it on the counter. This still usually leaves some extra-fine coffee dust stuck all over the place. Then when I remove the lid to get the coffee, I get coffee all over the counter.

I regret this purchase. I'm now shopping for a better grinder.

Looks fantastic! I leave it out on the counter because it looks great. Works to chop coffee beans into grounds like it's supposed to. Significantly quieter than my previous HB grinder that I had for years. Deducted 1 star because the prior Hamilton Beach grinder I bought at a store had a removable grinding chamber which makes it easier to empty and clean out, this is one piece and you have to tip the entire grinder upside down to empty it into the top. Also, the HB one had a pop out storage place for the cord to wrap up inside it. However, the HB one after years of use actually exploded on me while I was grinding beans and shaking it, and appears to have been because the cord that you wrap and store around it after years of doing that, was compromised. So I was actually relieved to know this one does not have that cord-storage feature. Knowing what I know now, I would buy this Mueller grinder again and again, especially at this price.

Very happy with this grinder! For the price, it does exactly what I need it to do. Do note that there are no settings and you kind of have to eyeball your grind. As someone who's worked in coffee for many years, I've adapted pretty well to it but I could see folks getting frustrated with it since they can't necessarily program the grind they like. It's pretty loud unfortunately but I've never woken up my roommates (that I know of). Easy to clean and has worked great for me for months.

So it works but it’s just really messy, after I grind the coffee I go to take off the clear lid and a little bit spills out every time. Plus it’s kind of awkward to pour out the ground coffee into my coffee maker from the grinder, I have to use a spoon so it goes into the filter and not all over the place. So it’s kind of a hassle and not user friendly.
Plus I haven’t gotten it to evenly grind the coffee beans. So it is what it is, it works but it’s not my favorite thing to use.

I received the grinder a couple of days ago and immediately put it to use. I had a recipe that required ground spices. It worked perfectly! I have also used it to grind coffee beans which also worked well. Great purchase!

I use the grinder strictly for coffee beans. I like my coffee strong. Which means starting with a fine grind. The Mueller HyperGrind gives me exactly what I want, and it does it fast. Whiz bang, done. I'm not sure why, but after grinding, there's minimum static electricity; so, there's minimum cling. As for cleaning, for me it's a non issue. I use it only on the same brand of coffee everyday. Nice product. Works well. Takes up minimum counter space.

reviews.reviewTitle: DOES WHAT IT IS SUPPOSED TO DO
reviews.reviewText: YOU CAN MAKE DIFFERANET GRIDS. COURSE, MEDIUM, FINE FOR TURKISH COFFEE. TO GET THE GRINF YOU WANT YOU PUSH AND HOLD THE SPRNG LOADED ON/OFF BUTTON FOR SO MANY SECONDS. I MY SELF JUST PUSH DOWN FOR TWO SECONDES, THEN CHECK THE GRIND AND GO FROM THERE. THERE IS NO CERTAIN SETTING SECTION. WOULD BE NICE IF THEY WOULD BE NICE IF THEY HAD A LEVER YOU COULD MOVE TO THE SECTION, AND IT WOULD SHUT OFF. THE GRINDER IS REALY WELL BUILT SHOULD LAST A LONG TIME. IT IS A BIT LOUD.

Just used my Mueller Austria grinder model# 550K for the first time and am glad I purchased this based off the reviews and I definitely agree with all the 5 star reviews, easy to clean, not to noisy (to me) and best of all 20 seconds of holding the button down to grind 5 scoops (2tblsp. scoop) to make a pot of delicious Don Pablo coffee and all is good. Great value purchased for under 20$. Also would like to add that after grinding for 20 seconds the grind of the coffee is perfect for me not too course like store bought and not too fine like your making espresso or turkish coffee.
I really like my grinder but it is extremely noisy. Does a GREAT job though so I can tolerate the noise for a minute or two.

reviews.reviewTitle: Pretty average. Hard to clean (therefore) hard to use. Keep looking!
reviews.reviewText: I was suspicious of the reviews posted for this grinder. If you read any review on Amazon without skepticism, you risk disappointment. Topline: It's just okay. I have a 12 cup coffeemaker and like my coffee strong. This grinder is a little small (more like 8 to 10 cup if you like strong coffee) ... I typically need to grind a full dose, followed by a 1/4 dose of beans. It typically takes a little longer for grinding than you think it should, and you will need to get good at pulsing, shaking and tapping ... but no biggie. Bottom-line: the metal grinder bowl is too short and the lid an awkward fit ... the whole process requires more clean-up and attention than anyone really wants to give early in the morning. I've owned other blade grinders that simply worked better / were easier to use and clean. I also have a burr grinder, but that is in a whole different price range and unfair to compare.

reviews.reviewTitle: THIS MUELLER GRINDER MAY BE SMALL, BUT GREAT THINGS ARRIVE IS SMALL PACKAGES!!!
reviews.reviewText: THIS MUELLER "GRUDEN GRINDER" I LIKE TO REFER TO IT AS, IS REMARKABLE! WHEN FILLED TO THE TOP OF THE STAINLESS STEEL INSIDE GRINDING AREA, THE GRINDER'S RESULT IS A FANTASTIC FINE GRIND IN A VERY SHORT AMOUNT OF TIME. THE TANTALIZING SMOOTH SOUND EMANATING FROM THIS GRINDER INFORMS ME THAT MUELLER TAKES PRIDE IN SELECTING THE RIGHT MOTOR, BEARINGS, SWITCH AND STAINLESS STEEL BLADE AND OTHER COMPONENTS. THIS IS DESIGNED TO LAST A LIFETIME OF PRODUCT GRINDING. THANK YOU!

I'm so happy I came across this coffee grinder. It's perfect for grinding whole chia seeds. It's quick and easy to use. To protect the stainless steel bottom, I used a wooden chopstick to scrape the bottom and sides of the stainless steel bowl. Cleanup was very easy too. I used a damp paper towel to clean the sides and bottom. Plus it's small so it doesn't take up a lot of space. I attached some pics. I would definitely recommend this grinder.

It's much better than I expected. It's super easy to use - just hold the button until you've reached desired level of coarseness. I do a super fine grind for my espresso machine and it doesn't take long at all. If I fill it with coffee beans, I get enough grounds to last me 3 days or so. I have yet to figure out an effective cleaning method. I only use it for coffee, so I'm not too worried about it.

Put my first couple scoops in and fired it up. Extremely loud and a good percentage of my grinds disappeared. Picked the thing up and somehow the grinds got in the motor housing and were coming out of the bottom vents. Now I have grinds all over my floor.

UPDATE: Seller confirmed it was a bad unit and was way ahead of getting a replacement out to me. By far amazing customer service ... thank you, Julia!

Does a great & consistent job of grinding. If there is a way to use this without making a mess when transferring the grounds, I have not discovered it. Even tapping it on the counter to knock down the grounds, I tend to spew them everywhere as I pull off the lid. Not sure what kind of solution there might be for this but don't remember having much trouble with previous grinder.

reviews.reviewTitle: Best coffee bean grinder for the cost, the size and the quality. I love it!!
reviews.reviewText:
I LOVE this product!! It’s so nice and small and sleek and not nearly as loud as so many others.

It was the best purchase I could have made, and being a first-time coffee bean buyer, I was lost on what grinder to get. So I did my research and Amazon revealed to me that yours was the choice.

They were right!!!

Thank you,
Julia

reviews.reviewTitle: Good, consistent grind and nice clear view window make for quick and easy use. Will update as we have it longer!
reviews.reviewText: Initial impressions: We have not had this long yet so we will see how it does with longevity. Should it hold out for a while, or not, I will update my review. So far we like it a lot. The grind is consistent and the noise is fairly quiet in comparison to our other grinder. The cleaning is pretty straight forward and the unit itself is very lightweight.

I love this grinder. It is easy to use and has enough capacity to grind a whole pot of coffee. It also has enough power to handle more than just coffee. I made this purchase earlier in the year. I thought it was all over when I recently tried to use it and it didn't work. I placed a call to the company that was almost immediately answered by a human. After a few quick questions and an address confirmation, my new unit will be here in a few days. Love my grinder AND the company that makes it.

I needed a coffee grinder that ground very fine and so far this grinder does the trick. The other grinders I have don’t grind as finely but is it because I’ve had them for awhile? This grinder is very stable. Noise level is about the same as the others.

I've been looking for an effective coffee grinder that was reasonable in cost and effective in supporting my on-going love affair with coffee. This one is the best so far. I'm not sure how long it will last but so far (1 week) it has performed admirable. However, a caveat - the motor is not as powerful as some of the others and the unit doesn't feel substantial but that shouldn't discourage buyers. I give this a 4-star rating.

Compared grounds to my pre-ground coffee that I get from the store. Grounds were inconsistent, a few pieces were 1 /4 long. In general, the grounds were somewhat courser than the storebought, even after several attempts

reviews.reviewTitle: A little noisy but a great grind.
reviews.reviewText: I like the grinder it does an excellent job. The noise level is a little high. But does so much better than my old grinder, it takes a longer period of time to use. This one whips it out in a few seconds. I would buy again only complaint is a little loud. But no longer than what you have to use it for a grind That's great.

reviews.reviewTitle: INSIDE FILLED WITH COFFEE AFTER FIRST USE, SUPER CHEAP
reviews.reviewText:
Ground coffee quite literally exploded out of the bottom of this device during its first use. The bottom was not fully attached which offset everything else and created a gap between the plastic cover and the bed of the grinder where the beans are placed allowing the grinds to get everywhere.

I unscrewed the bottom so I could shove everything back in place and noticed the electrical cord tied in a knot to keep it from coming through the plastic the case. I make lamps for a living and know that this is NOT UL certifiable. Additionally, the knot in the cord obstructed the bottom of the device, which offset everything else.

Ultimately, this is super cheap grinder made in china and branded with Austria to make consumers think otherwise. Don't waste your money.
I have tried many grinders over the years and this one is the best. It is so quiet that I can grind beans at 5 am and not wake anyone up. And it seems to grind faster than other products. Recommend.

reviews.reviewTitle: Died after 6 months of occasional use
reviews.reviewText: I don’t use the grinder very often, 2-3 times per month and I’ve had it for 6 months. Went to use it one day and the blade was seized. Motor could be heard trying to spin but the blade wouldn’t move. Took it apart to try and fix it but wasn’t successful. It had good reviews, guess I was unlucky. I’ll go buy a different brand. Why would I pay for a $20 product to be shipped in for warranty and wait several weeks to get it back?

This is a really nice but somewhat small grinder. I probably drink too much coffee compared to others who are making it for just 1 or 2 people. I always end up filling it too much and it makes the lid just a hair tougher to put on. I'm giving it four stars because it's a quality grinder but not quite the best for me.
Perfectly ground coffee every time. And the scent of fresh ground coffee beans can't be beat.

This is a very good grinder. I use it daily. It is fairly quiet. It is much faster than the one I had previous to this and does a good job grinding up all the beans. The only reason for 4 stars is it is a bit harder to clean. The stainless coffee bowl interior only comes up about half way inside so where it meets plastic is a seam that catches the ground coffee and it is hard to get it all out by wiping with a paper towel. I have always wiped my grinders clean as I don't like to get a lot of water on them. Overall though I like the grinder.

The grinder worked fine...until it didn't. In less than four months we let the smoke out and the unit stopped working. This was not a tortured device and only saw normal use of grinding a full hopper or two every week (for around 10-15 seconds per hopper). Time to move on to another brand.
I really love this grinder it is perfect for a coarse grind for a French press!

Wanted a large capacity electric grinder mill for grinding my flax seeds and the like and this one was perfect. Didn't need anything fancy. It's easy to use, quick, and gets the job done. A little tricky to clean around the non-removable blades but for the money, does what I need it to do.

I only wish that it were a little bigger! BUT, that being said, it can grind enough coffee to fill my little container and get me through a few days (I don't drink a ton of coffee). And I could grind it as finely as I wished! Heaven. It was a little difficult to clean, but that's fine. I really like its simplicity and that it fits in my coffee-stuff cupboard.

The first time I used it grinds fell inside the body and all over my counter, and when I inspected closely I could see the metal cup was not seated properly against the plastic, leaving a gap for grinds to fall through.

I took it apart to clean and saw that the bottom was improperly fitted, and since the bottom holds the cup and grinder assembly in place, the cup was dislocated as well.

After some air duster and a mess in my kitchen, reassembly was simple enough and it works OK.

It's a fine grinder. Just iffy QC but what do you want from an Amazon special? Overall it's OK. Hope it lasts longer than it's build quality suggests it might.

reviews.reviewTitle: grinds great, sound is minimal... better than other grinders I have used for 4 times the price
reviews.reviewText: Highly recommend this grinder. Very functional, especially for the price. Only think missing is the ability to adjust the grind size. However, the length of time you grind determines whether it is course or fine. Obviously, the longer you grind the finer it becomes.

It's so quiet, so fast and easy to clean. Compared to my old coffee grinder this thing is unreal. Not that my old one broke, we just bought a small espresso machine and thought a new grinder was a good idea so we went for it (old grinder now for spices :)) No regrets here that's for sure.

reviews.reviewTitle: Get the job done in no time!
reviews.reviewText: I am considering to get another one for grinding spices, as this thing is very efficient and inexpensive. I put the beans in and operated it, at the same time yelled out to my son in the living room (his name has only one syllable), the beans got ground!

This thing makes a damn mess! It's fine until you remove the lid. Coffee grounds everywhere....
Doesn't have a removable cup. Didn't come with a cleaning brush.... Soooo "clean up" is also messy.
The only reason I'm keeping it is because it was cheap, it's quiet, and it grinds nicely.
It stopped working after 3 uses. It seemed to be great product until this happened.

This is an excellent grinder for spices. I threw in several spices at once (a 3-inch cinnamon stick, a whole star anise, a handful of cardamom seeds, and whole cloves) to put it through its paces, and it ground them to a powder in seconds. It's quiet, too. Definitely the best (and quietest!) spice grinder I've tried. I'm glad I got this grinder , and I highly recommend it.

reviews.reviewTitle: Fell apart, coffee grounds went everywhere
reviews.reviewText: I only got to use it once. When I pulled it out of the box, the bottom was falling out. I snapped it back in and it worked fine for one batch of coffee, then the bottom fell out again and it won’t go back together... It worked well when it did work...
I used it only one time !!!! And then, it stopped working ....I wish you refund me!

Well, it totally works! And does a great job grinding coffee beans. It's not quiet, but that's true of all machines that "grind", and it is a little tough to clean - don't get your fingers cut, but since it's only for coffee, I don't lose sleep over it. Great tool.

It’s noisey but you don’t have it on that long. Small shape hides away easily but design and color make it suitable to leave out on counter. The grind coarseness is a result of length of grind not an adjust of blade or other setting.Not a problem for me as I’m using coarse grounds for a french press.

I can get my coffee beans ground to the fine powder needed for stove-top coffee makers in a few seconds. I like the design and how safe it is to operate. Cleaning is easy; all I need is a a dry brush and it looks like new very quickly. Its small size make it easily storable, although a bigger hopper would make the need for grading less frequent.
I originally loved this grinder. Unfortunately it stopped working after the 5th use.

I've had the coffee grinder for several months and it is holding up well. Also, it grinds the coffee up well -- better than my previous one. It also has a larger capacity and the corners clean up easier. The only thing I would recommend is that they offer it in other colors.

reviews.reviewTitle: Mueller Austria HyperGrind Precision Electric Coffee Grinder Mill with Large Grinding Capacity
reviews.reviewText:
Mueller Austria HyperGrind Precision Electric Coffee Grinder Mill with Large Grinding Capacity and HD Motor . The grinder works great and the price is right on spot. You should supply a small brush to clean out the coffee grounds.
Very happy with the device..

Let me preface by saying there's nothing *wrong* with this grinder, per se. It's just that there's also nothing especially great about it. The grinding capacity is unimpressive and coffee falls all over when you take off the lid. Unfortunately, taking the lid off is the only way to really check on the grind. I'm not sad that I bought it, but when it goes I'll certainly be upgrading.

Never really used one before but I messed up and got coffee beans not ground coffee! So I went to amazon and purchased this machine! It is honestly pretty small, but it does the job! Sure it took me 15-20 minutes to finish one whole bag, but the house smelled amazing after!

reviews.reviewTitle: Great grinds but kind of pain to get them out.
reviews.reviewText: It makes good even grind. Kind of pain you have to turn it upside down to pour grinds out. My last one let you remove the whole cup. I’m bound to dump grinds everywhere any day now. Looks nice, hope it last long time.

Without exaggeration- I ordered first one, ground up 10 oz without trouble but then it did not work again. I returned it and got prompt replacement. I thought perhaps I wouldn’t grind so much all at once so I “ babied” it and only ground for 1 pot- the next time I tried to use- dead again. Wanted to review b4 it went in trash. I ended up happy with a Krupp’s grinding enough for a weekly supply as I have always done

I'm really happy so far, it's a little noisy when you're grinding the beans but I don't think there is much you can do to avoid that. The longer you grind the finer the grounds get. It's been great and for a good price. I'm very happy with it, thank you!

This product is sleek looking and very easy to use. You just put the coffee in and push the button. I reground some drip grind into espresso grind, and it gave me a very fine, consistent grind. I would prefer if the blade was removable for easier cleaning, but it doesn’t take much effort to wipe it out with a cloth after use. It also looks nice on my countertop.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great! But needs to come with a brush.
reviews.reviewText: I really like this unit. It's easy to use, the noise level isn't too bad and it grinds perfectly. My only complaint is that it needs to come with a brush. My old grinder came with one. Luckily, I kept that brush, but I shouldn't have had to. I didn't knock off any stars, as this is a personal preference issue.

I've had several different name brand grinders over the years - some better than others. This Mueller is really quite well-made! It grinds well and is relatively quiet. I've seen reviews stating that it may be under-powered, but I don't find that to be the case at all. Many appliances/tools are made with noise generators as part of their makeup. Many people believe the more sound it makes, then it has to be more powerful. No extra noise here. Just a solid little grinder that gets the job done.

I write few reviews, but this product demands one! When my Krups Coffee Grinder died after 25 years, I got one from a big box store which will remain nameless to protect the accessory. That machine was an engineering marvel. It pulverizes 3/4ths of the beans and left the remainder unscathed!

The blade in this Mueller circulates the coffee very efficiently and quietly produces a brew grind in 8 seconds. Quality like this might make me less cynical in life... probably not though.

The product looks great on the picture. But hard to use since you need to hand control the grinder, and often the result is not came out as you want. It is also hard to clean since there is no separated tray for coffee, so that you can't clean it well, not even get your grinding coffee all out. Not recommend the product.
Great little product, grinder holds not more then a pot of coffee, per grinding.

Easy! This grinder is amazing. It might take a few tries to get your preferred grind, but the packet that it comes with really helps as a guide. The coffee grounds can get stuck to the sides so just be aware of that and make sure to wipe it down with a dry cloth if you’re going to use a different roast.

My husband decided to stop hand grinding his coffee so I ordered this for him. Much quieter than his old grinder, and also much faster. The fine ground does tend to stick to the side of the grinder but he had no problem getting it out.

I recently purchased this item after I won a bag of coffee beans, and could not find my old grinder. It takes up little counter space, works fast (I grind for about 6 seconds) and is easy to get the grounds out of the grinder and into my french press. We noticed a huge difference in the taste of fresh ground beans versus coffee already bought at the store ground up. Happy customer!

I've replaced my other coffee grinder with this product and am so glad I did. There were two compartments to clean and they weren't easy to get to on my other model. This one has only one compartment to clean and it's easy to get into it. It wipes out in seconds! The grinder works really well. Do follow the manual for length of time that the blades run in order to get the finishing size you desire from your coffee beans. I also like that you can use this with spices, herbs, nuts and grains.

reviews.reviewTitle: Motor died after only a few uses
reviews.reviewText: I have had the grinder for a very short period - only a few uses. However, the motor has already burnt out.

reviews.reviewTitle: Get the job done quickly and quietly!
reviews.reviewText: I purchased this grinder because it looked great and had really good reviews. Our last grinder we have used and loved for almost 10 years, but it was clear the motor was dying a slow death. The Mueller grinder has a powerful and relatively quiet motor! It grinds really quickly and makes much less noise than our last one did. We love it!

reviews.reviewTitle: Capable of providing multiple grind levels
reviews.reviewText: Our previous coffee grinder never ground the beans fine enough (espresso grind)). This product worked as advertised- and we are very pleased.
This product last one month and and then it stopped work, had to throw it away and buy different brand
Just got it and used it this morning! Works great so far and the coffee was soooo good!

I bought this mainly to grind Ceylon Cinnamon and other spices. Works well at that task without letting ground material escape like my old grinder did. It's not quiet, but the sound of this motor is less irritating the previous grinders I have had. The Mueller Coffee Grinder feels very stable and works relatively quickly. Unfortunately, the plastic cup has two small inner supports that ground material collects on. I wish the supports were not there, or located on the exterior. But that is a small issue. It is not a deal breaker for an excellent grinder.

The grinder worked wonderfully until I went to use it for the second time.
At first I thought it was the outlet or the extension cord. But then I realized it was the grinder itself. It no longer worked.
So unfortunately, I will be sending it back.

The grinder was in pieces when I opened the package. Nothing broken. I tried to snap it back together to no avail. Also it was made in China not Austria. I sent it back which was easy, thanks Amazon. The grinder seemed very cheap and I did not reorder a different one. I do not recommend.

reviews.reviewTitle: ... getting the hang of timing my grind for the perfect french press
reviews.reviewText: Still getting the hang of timing my grind for the perfect french press, but this is a great little grinder. Affordable, compact and speedy. What's not to like? My only complaint is that I wish it were available in black. My coffee tastes much better now that I'm grinding it fresh each morning.
small yet efficient grinder! not fancy, but good for everyday usage. The only thing I wish it can improve is the thorough cleaning of the grinder, because it cannot touch water.

reviews.reviewTitle: Fantastic quality for a great price
reviews.reviewText: This product is durable and not as noisy as other grinders. Operates smoothly. Arrived quickly and securely packaged.
This is my first coffee grinder, I really like this brand, it's it easy to use and pretty quiet.
We use this coffee grinder every day. It works great - it's had no issues whatsoever. Like any coffee grinder, it's not super easy to clean, but it's just coffee in there so that's no big deal.
Easy to use... Doesn't take up barely any space.. fit's nicely next to my coffee maker.
I really like this product. I had one before very similar and I like the quality. So far so good.

This coffee grinder is just what I was hoping for, powerful, creates consistent grind results, is easy to clean and doesn’t take up too much space. Noise level is moderate to loud, but it’s a coffee grinder and the time it needs to be activated is minimal due to its efficiency. Economical to purchase, good looking and predictable results was everything I was looking for.

reviews.reviewTitle: Really messy, no timer, inconsistent grind
reviews.reviewText: The grind size is inconsistent, and there are no timers or settings, just an on/off button. Static electricity from grinding makes ground beans go everywhere when trying to dispense. The shape of the lid makes it inconvenient to cleanly invert ground coffee into the lid for transfer to my french press. I want my Hamilton Beach back.

The HyperGrind has proven to be an excellent electric coffee grinder...a powerful and quiet motor with a solid base and clear view into the grinding chamber makes it easy to control the grinds from French press to espresso. That control has prompted me to get another for spices. Great machine and a great value.

Grinder works well. It's small enough to make as little or as much coffee as I'd like, and takes up little space on the counter. Only thing I might change is making it a little easier to clean out. Other than that it's great.
I love the power it has. And how fast it grinds to the perfect grind. All around great product.

reviews.reviewTitle: A Suitable Coffee Bean Grinder; Great Value
reviews.reviewText: I originally had a manual burr grinder, but without planetary gearing, I was grinding coffee beans all day. With three "pulses" of this Müeller grinder, my beans are ready for the hot water. I need some kind of soft brush to keep it free of coffee grinds that collect, but for the price, this likely outperforms grinders at five times the price.

I am surprised by how much I like this grinder--it does feel a bit silly to turn it upside down and shake the grounds out into the cup/lid to take over to my coffee maker, but I couldn't ask for a better compact grinder, especially for the price. Very happy!
Great for grinding coffee or spices. Easy to clean. Arrived promptly. Recommend.

I love it! Cute little thing makes quick work of my coffee beans. It makes a huge mess every use and is a pain to clean. I have yet to completely clean the blade rotor because you cannot get it wet. This is frustrating, I don't like the residue.
Works like a charm. I grind coffee for a French press.

This is not as easy to clean as I had hoped. The coffee gets lodged in the machine and takes a few extra minutes but for the price it works well and have had no issues with performance. I would recommend this product

At first, I was comprehensive on buying this reading some of the reviews however I am pleased with the grinder. It grinds perfectly and is easy to use. I was needing a coffee grinder to simply grind coffee beans for my Kureg. I don’t know why so many reviews knit picked this grinder so much. If you want something with more bells and whistles then this is not the grinder for you.

reviews.reviewTitle: Quit after a month of daily use. I do think it’s fluke though
reviews.reviewText:
First Grinder is super quiet! It did a great job for the month we used it. Unfortunately it quit mid grind and now isn’t working.
I have a friend that has one too and she LOVES it.
It doesn't have 3 speeds as indicated in the description but it does the job. Let's see if it holds up over time. I like that it can get my coffee and herbs to a fine powder if I want.
Works great so far and easy to use! Have only used 2 x so far so can’t rate durability right now.

reviews.reviewTitle: Does not live up to it's claim
reviews.reviewText: This item claims it can grind spices and coffee which is ridiculous. The blades me be able to cut spices, when it comes to girding coffee it is a total failure. Are the other reviews online bogus??? The experiences it boast online is totally the opposite of mine. I am trying to find a good grinder that can grind my coffee beans, herbs and spices, and beans to make bean flour.
Loved it when I first got it. It quit working after 2 months. I would not recommend this product.
I kind of wish I got something a bit larger capacity but for the price and power this gives, I’m happy with it. And, yes, it is as quiet as a grinder could probably be.

reviews.reviewTitle: The machine broke with in two months and after only about 4 or 5 uses.
reviews.reviewText: I contact Amazon and they tried to help me return it. I told I could return it even though it was past the 30 day return. It never happen. They said one thing and then ignored me. Why should an appliance have only a 30 day guarantee. That tells you the quality of the Appliance.... I learned that if a company doesn't stand behind their product better than that you can bet it a sign not to waste your money. My bet.....this won't be published. Vici from TX.
Can’t believe I waited so long to get one. Can’t beat this for the $$$.
We use this grinder to bring coffee beans. Fast grind, will grind to fine grind in moments, so keep watch. Easy to clean.
Love my little coffee bean grinder. I love a freshly ground cup.of organic coffee in the mornings. Perfect for 1 or 2 cups in Keurig filter.

Very easy to operate. Simply pour your beans and press the button. One of the best things about this is the informational booklet that it comes with. There is a conversion chart of tablespoon of coffee beans to cups of coffee. Using the chart I was able to make a great cup of coffee.
A powerful little gadget! Works like a breeze to grind my coffee beans just right. I use a hand press and the directions told me exactly how to grind for the press!
Very quiet and easy to use. Looks and feels like good quality. Expect many years of reliable service.

reviews.reviewTitle: Works great, a little hard to clean
reviews.reviewText:
Works great! I get a nice fine blend every time.

A little hard to clean since you cant wash it out. I always tend to have a few lingering grains

reviews.reviewTitle: The grinder arrived promptly as specified in the details!
reviews.reviewText: The grinder works wonderfully and I'm happy with the purchase. After ordering I found out the company that ships this item employs those with disabilities which put a smile to my face. I work with those in the special education field and always appreciate companies that see the importance behind giving those with special needs a chance to better themselves.
My husband and I were surprised with how quite this little machine is! It grinds coffee very quickly and very well and is easy to store away!
Mueller never disappoints. I can grind my coffee or spices to whatever state I please. Awesome.

reviews.reviewTitle: Easy to grind but lacks some desirable functions our other grinders had
reviews.reviewText: Easy to use and easy to clean. The construction is solid and functional. However, it is not our favorite grinder as there is no easy way to measure how much comes out of the grind which we were use to. A marker on the grinder top could be useful. The grind size is based on how long you push the button so somewhat a trial-and-error every time you try a new brand of beans or if you make your coffee using different machines (filter, french press, chemex, etc). Good value for the price though.

reviews.reviewTitle: Lifestyle change due to coffee grinder
reviews.reviewText: I used to buy instant coffee but with the Mueller coffee grinder my coffee is custom made for me, by myself! Coffee smells and tastes more pure !
I am so impressed with my Muller coffee mill. It's not noisy. And mostly it grinds coffee so quickly, I'm amazed. Just love it!
So easy to use and clean! I bought this for grinding beans for my French press. Needless to say, I am a very happy customer!
I love the simple design and the clear and concise instructions! The customer support is stellar. This company checks your satisfaction and mine is A++++
Fine quality at a decent price, thank you!

reviews.reviewTitle: This is a nice looking grinder
reviews.reviewText:
This is a nice looking grinder. It is highly efficient and powerful. I was impressed how quickly it ground the coffee beans. I would have preferred if all the interior was lined with aluminum - this would have just given the interior a cleaner look.
It has good capacity, so far I am happy with this product.

reviews.reviewTitle: Decent coffee grinder, with cool design and low price tag
reviews.reviewText:
Easy to use coffee bean grinder with a simple, sleek design.

This ones a tad taller than the popular Krup coffee grinder, but still takes up very little counter space.

While waiting for the kettle to heat the water, I’ve got plenty of time to grind my coffee beans fresh.

During the first couple of uses, I noticed an uneven grind but that could have been user error.
Didn't grind as fine as I like. Rather than small "solids" I wanted it powdered for more surface areas. But still one of the better ones
The product is nice, good quality, reasonable price, stylish design and easy to use. In fact, Ilike this brand, I have bought severe products from this brand.

reviews.reviewTitle: The Mueller HyperGrind is an excellent product! It grinds to different size grounds just ...
reviews.reviewText: The Mueller HyperGrind is an excellent product! It grinds to different size grounds just how the Instruction Manual specifies it will. It is well built, and easy to clean. I would recommend this product to anyone to buy, and you cannot beat the low price.
The mill does a wonderful job of getting consistent coffee. I love the way it works, and clean up is a breeze.
This coffee grinder works well, and fast. In no time at all, my coffee beans are ground and ready for the coffee pot.

reviews.reviewTitle: Ours broke the first time we used it
reviews.reviewText: Everything looked good but it started smoking and quit working by the 3rd batch of beans. Maybe we just got a defective one.
The only thing that comes off is the lid. After you grind the beans you either have to dump Iver the enire plugged in machine or try to scoop out the grounds from under the blade. Not impressed.

reviews.reviewTitle: Your Hours Chopping Herbs are Over!
reviews.reviewText: Talk about versatile. This machine can grind fresh herbs in seconds. Saves time and you can use it for fresh coffee bean grinding.

We just bought this grinder after the one we had for 20 years finally stopped working. So far, this is working well.
I was surprised to see that it is made in China, but am assuming that the high standard normally expected for Austrian products has been met. I have not tried to grind spices.
It is reasonably priced and seems to be a good purchase.
Great product

I purchased it for herb grinding like it claims to do. It will grind to a very fine power, but the whole time, powder is getting spewed out around the button to run it. You end up with a big mess. Just got mine out of the box and now it is going right back in the box.
This lasted about two weeks and started to slow down and then stopped. Never to grind again.
Excellent grinder. Provides lots of options for grind variety. I would recommend it to anyone. Good price too.

Seller delivered Fast and as always Amazon makes things so easy. This sexy, white coffee grinder is solid, powerful and quiet (that is for a grinder :) Should last an extraordinary long time; would definitely purchase again and/or as a Gift!
It works great and looks great too. Only small issue is the top comes off too easily. A very minor nit for sure.

This is a very nice little coffee grinder. I use the Mieller French P{reds coffee maker (also great) and I like decaf. Very hard to find coarse ground decaf coffee so I get the whole bean decaf (much easier to find) and grind my own. Works great!
Purchased this for grinding sugar and spices. Worked the first time, but it lagged. The second time I used it hummed, spun and shut off. Don't spend your money on this grinder.
Love this lil guy. Quiet, strong..only complaint is if you overload it, it spills everywhere after turning it over to open. Minor. Its a great buy. I had one for 8 years once. Reccomend
Good little. Grinder no sure how it will hold up my wife uses it as it is hard for her to you my crank one.
I bought it to grind herbs, and it is wonderful on dried ones. I haven't tried it on fresh ones.

reviews.reviewTitle: Plastic parts break easily. Not easy to clean
reviews.reviewText: Worked fine until the plastic lid/cup cracked and chipped on 1rst use. Not easy to clean as the blade does not remove for cleaning.
Its not a bad grinder for the money. Seems a little underpowered when you stop it and start it again under a full load of grounds the motor is noticeably strained. Not bad for one person jobs...

Overall it is relatively easy to clean and use. However, the product broke the second time I used it.

Like other customers said, coffee grinds easily find their way into the motor.

I recommend you do not purchase this product.
I bought this to use for making “broken” rice, the main ingredient in rice porridge and it works perfectly.

reviews.reviewTitle: Poor quality product. Save your money
reviews.reviewText:
I purchased this product the first time, used it for approx. 3mins. and it stopped working. I called support, they were helpful and sent me a new one. I just used the new grinder, it lasted about 4ish mins. and stopped working. I called support again and requested my money back and they are doing so.

Support is nice and helpful, but the product is garbage.

reviews.reviewTitle: This little guy puts in WORK
reviews.reviewText: Didn't expect it to work as well as it did for how small it is, but dang. 100% will buy again.
Works great! Received it quickly. Just the right size. Wish the cord could be wrapped around it.

reviews.reviewTitle: Very good appliance at a great price.
reviews.reviewText: Not sure why I didnt start grinding my pen coffee years ago. This little grinder makes it easy to get great tasting coffee in seconds.
Used it three times and then it completely stopped working. I returned it for a refund.
The size of the grinder is perfect for me. It is powerful enough to grind everything I need to grind.

This grinder worked great until, less than 5 months after purchase, the entire thing fell apart.
I picked it up and the white plastic came off of the base exposing the inner workings which were also no longer secured and flopping around. I tried to fix it but no luck.
See photo

Hi, I found country of origin on unit is China. In questions and answers it’s clearly said Austria and that was my main reason in decision to make this purchase(Both photos attached). Please explain. Thanks
So disappointed in Mueller. It broke after only two months and not many uses at all. I used a Walmart one for years continuously with no issues. And both made in China. Don’t buy!
This machine works excellently and saves a lot of time compared to hand-grinders. My wrists and fingers love it. One push of the start button and you're done
I am very happy with this purchase. It is very wasy to clan, use and hardly any noise. Great customer service.
Nothing to dislike. It is a great grinder for $20.00. It holds more than my old one did, which is nice.

The product came disassembled. I'm a handy person, but there was no way I could reassemble it. Why? Well there isn't an attachment for the bottom section. As far as I can tell, it's glued into the base. Shameful quality. Not deserving of a German name.
Only used a few times and it burnt up literally had smoke coming out of it.

reviews.reviewTitle: It's a good simple coffee grinder
reviews.reviewText: It's exactly what I needed - easy to use, and a good ground coffee space volume.
Exactly what I was looking for, wish it held a bit more coffee but I just run it twice.
By far the quietest coffee grinder I have ever seen in my life. Quality Austrian engineering.

I bought this grinder in April 2019 and it stopped working in October 2019. I probably ground 8 lbs of coffee beans in it during that time. This is pathetic! What’s more the return policy expired in early May. Needless to say, I won’t purchase this brand again.

reviews.reviewTitle: Broke both times I bought it. Bought 2x
reviews.reviewText: Significant amounts of coffee grounds get into the middle chamber of this product and fall out the bottom because the metal lip is not snug. It happened on one I bought. I returned it and the same happened with the second.
Quiet & fast grind, quality product, I could not be any happier with my purchase!

reviews.reviewTitle: For great tasting coffee- use this grinder!
reviews.reviewText: I use this product for grinding coffee. It is very much the same as used in Europe. It helps make excellent coffee.
Love this little grinder. I now have one for coffee and another for spices.
This is a lightweight machine that works well. It is fairly quiet and very easy to use.

Bought as a gift for my husband and he loves it! We love to cook and make specialty coffees at home, so this was perfect for grinding spices and coffee beans. It isn't as noisy as some of the other grinders we've seen, and it isn't too big and bulky either. Does exactly what we hoped for at a decent price.
This grinder is powerful and quiet. It has a small capacity so it is a good single use grinder.
It works fine and I received on time. I'm using it as a spice/herb grinder.

reviews.reviewTitle: See what you want in a store THEN buy it on Amazon.
reviews.reviewText: I bought it to grind my coffee but was disappointed because the bowl is not removable. It's also harder to clean than my old one.
This burnt out on our first use. I tried unplugging it for a while, nothing. Waste of money.
I bought the Mueller to replace my Braun seed grinder, which I use occasionally for coffee, but mostly for nuts and seeds. The Mueller does a better job and is noticeably less loud.
This coffee grinder worked like a charm and was exactly as described! It does the job quickly and the size is nicely compact.
This thing was great until it stopped working one month in. Made a funny noise, blade slowed and then it was lights out.
The first and only time I used it, the machine stopped grinding mid-grind and never worked again.
Exactly as described. Easy to use, perfect size for storing, easy to clean.
Perfect! Mine is used exclusively to grind up spices. Extremely quiet and efficient!
I have been using this for a year now and it is still working well.

It worked perfectly for 11 months then broke. Took care of it as in instructions. This is unfortunate that Austrian products are made in China which cares less about quality.

Update 8/24/19
But seller did contact me and offered a replacement. I was pleasantly surprised by this offer and now have a replacement that seem to be working well.
It does exactly what it is supposed to do. Easy to handle. Does not take long to grind the coffee.
I bought it because it said it different settings for coarseness. It doesn't.
Love this grinder! My old one was so loud! This one is smooth and quiet! Easy to clean also!
Had it less than a week and used it a couple times to gind my coffee beans. On about the 4th or 5th time of use It just stopped working. It's a complete waste of money. Do not buy this grinder!
I love how quiet this is. It grinds my coffee beans perfectly and was an ideal price.

reviews.reviewTitle: Good grinder and very low noise
reviews.reviewText: I use it to grind coffee and flax seeds. It is fantastic and it isn’t noisy. I give it an A+
After purchasing it for four months, it just stopped working. I'm past the return date and I am frustrated by the short period of time it actually work

Motor burned out after just 2 weeks of use, and it was only used for coffee beans. Also, the capacity is too small for grinding the quantity of beans needed to brew a full carafe (12cups). Don't waste your money if you're using this for coffee beans.
Its pretty efficient. Gets messy easy. No real way to clean this item except to spot clean.

I recently ordered this and totally Love everything about it!! I Love coffee and I wanted to try getting the coffee Beans and grinding my own. This product is compact and works great. It's easy to use. Easy to clean. Easy to store as well!! Would recommend!

reviews.reviewTitle: Years of coffee drinking all over the globe
reviews.reviewText: A modest (in a good sense), &, so far, reliable coffee bean grinder. Decades of coffee drinking have moved us towards simplicity (even, gasp, an occasional "instant coffee" treat, i.e Brasilian coffee marketed here for a Latino clientele); & this little machine is quite appropriate.
