reviews.reviewTitle: Great, quiet grinder but a little annoying to clean.
reviews.reviewText:
I chose this grinder based on the high number of positive reviews. It has not disappointed me at all. It is fairly quiet with just a high pitched wine. I was worried about a grinder sounding like a blender, but this is easy on the ears.
Grinding 2-3 scoops of beans is easy and takes 12-15 seconds. The grind is consistent. My only issue is cleaning the grinder near the blades. It says to not imerge into water which makes clean up a little annoying.

For this price point, this grinder is perfect.

I really love this grinder! I had to take some time to read the instructions since it was my first time using a manual grinder, but once I did, it worked well! It does take some time to grind, so, not for impatient people. The final product is worth the time, in my opinion. Great company offered a free peeler just for buying and leaving a review!
It is compact, grinds coffee beans well (or anything else), and it is easy to use! My family and I enjoy this product immensely. Would recommend.

The Mueller Coffee Grinder is extremely easy to use and is solidly built. You can grind fine or course and everything in between. The price is low but the quality is high. I'd buy it again however given the quality I doubt it will be necessary.
Small and compact but a high performer!. Easy to use and provides a consistent grind. Noise level is good. Would recommend to a friend and would purchase another.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great coffee grinder for the price!
reviews.reviewText:
Love this coffee grinder! Got it as a gift and would definitely recommend it to others!
It doesn’t grind the beans super evenly. Sometimes there are still whole beans and super fine powder. But all in all a great grinder! Easy to use, easy to clean!
A great coffee grinder that make nice fine ground coffee. Would recommend to a friend.
Beautiful design and compact too! Came in quick with tips and illustrated instructions inside for those that never used a electic grinder before.
Stylish, grinds well. Safe.
I used this coffee grinder 2xs and it just quit working, would not recommend
The depth of the bowl is a little small, but overall it works really well. I actually bought it to grind spices, not coffee.
As usual, Amazon has delivered what I asked for on time. It is exactly as avertised.
Great coffee grinder! Compact and easy to use. Would highly recommend
We use it to grind coffee beans each morning. Love using the device.
This product is amazingly easy to use and if you love the smell of fresh ground coffee you can not go wrong.
Very easy to use, does not take long to perfectly grind beans.
I love our new coffee grinder! It is compact but effective, and very convenient. Highly recommend!
Good
Great product!!!
Compact, heavy duty and easy to use.
Works great!
Liked for coffee and nuts

I was excited to give this a try along with going with a new method to brewing my coffee beans (whole beans grinded myself) and needed a good storage for the beans. Saw the reviews on this, and despite the higher price, thought I'd give it a try. I received the product and was pleasantly surprised with the packaging. As soon as I took the canister out and sat it on the counter, I noticed that it was sitting lopsided. Took a look at the bottom and found that the perforated bottom was pointed outwards as if the canister was dented from the inside. I've attached the picture to better illustrate the image. I'm a little bummed out and will be shipping the product back, still contemplating if i really want to give it another try or look for something else.

What I appreciate this product for (more than the price even) is the simplicity of working it. You literally push the top down gently and this thing grinds beans to grounds in 9 seconds flat. Also comes with a handy measuring guide of how many beans to grind for the amount of coffee you need while preserving taste. Easy to clean and re-use. Would highly recommend this product for anyone looking for a great coffee grinder at a great price.

Very nice design. Not bulky, but large enough to grind enough beans for any large coffee maker. The interior, thankfully, has no nooks and crannies, making it easy to get really clean. Pulsing gives the most even grind - and much faster than other grinders I have had. It is also surprisingly quiet.
No false claims here!

This coffee bean grinder is super quick, grinding beans in 5-10 seconds. Unfortunately, the grind it puts out is completely uneven. We're talking some of the beans reduced to fine powder while others are still in halves or quarters. This is fine for cheap drip coffee makers (how I usually make coffee these days) but if you are wanting to do any sort of pour over, aeropress, espresso, etc, this grinder will be a big let down. If I want to do those things I use my manual grinder, which produces a completely uniform grind.

The grinder is mostly made of plastic which apparently is possessed of a vicious static cling. This means it's basically impossible to get the thing clean by wiping it down with a dry cloth. You can get it to a satisfactory state of clean but it takes longer than it should.

They're giving away veggie peelers in exchange for reviews, which probably explains all of the positive press here. I don't need a veggie peeler so I'm writing an honest review.

It's solidly built and very easy to use. It's not a horrible coffee grinder. It's just not a particularly good one. You get what you pay for.

reviews.reviewTitle: Very durable product and Consistent grinding!
reviews.reviewText: I love this coffee grinder!! My favorite thing about this grinder is that it grinds the beans very consisteny and even depending on how big or small you want them! its probably great for travel as well! The only thing I would say is that if I wanted to grind a lot of beans, i would have to do it in batches instead of one, but overall i am very happy with this product!!

reviews.reviewTitle: Does a great job, but one negative.
reviews.reviewText: Good powerful motor that grinds coffee beans quickly and completely. I had a similar Cuisinart for a long time that just recently gave up. This one has a stronger motor and I do like it. The only negative is that after grinding there is always a layer of very finely ground coffee stuck to the bottom that I have to scrape off with a popsicle stick. I would say the layer is about 1/16" thick. It's not a huge deal but this is something I never had to do with the Cuisinart. If someone has suggestions on something that's food safe that I could apply to the surface to keep it from sticking, I would certainly appreciate it.

reviews.reviewTitle: Awesome product and awesome costumer service!
reviews.reviewText:
I ordered the grinder at the beginning of July and used it occasionally and it worked perfectly every time, 2 weeks ago, after using the grinder for more times in a raw then usual, it stopped working.

I skipped amazon and sent an email to the company, explaining what happened.
Frank from costumer support reply within an hour, apologized and sent me a new one which I received a few days later that works perfect!
I loved the product before it happened, Also I understand that it’s a small machine that I needed to go a little easier on, but for its size and price it is just perfect.

The best part was obviously the great costumer service, that treated me as first class costumer and didn’t hesitate to send me a new grinder without even expecting me to send the old one, to save me time and bother.

I don’t only recommend this grinder- but the company it self, and hope that as myself, many more will support this great family owned business.

reviews.reviewTitle: Terrible quality control: The blade hits the side of the cup!
reviews.reviewText: Made in Germany! Way better than that stuff made in China, right! NOT!! I read a few reviews that mentioned this same defect, but I let the "Germany" shtick sway my judgement. OK, so the shaft on which the blade is mounted comes up through the bottom of the bowl OFF CENTER. I'm glad I plugged it in and turned it on before pouring in some of my expensive beans that would then have had metal shavings in them. The noise when I first turned it on was frightening, as the blade started cutting a groove into the side of the stainless bowl. What a disappointment this thing was. Also, don't let the advertising about how much better a job it does grinding beans than the other similar coffee grinders. NOT! One look into the top of this thing shows that other than the cutter being off-center, it looks EXACTLY like every other coffee grinder out there. The blade and even the plastic nut that holds it down look exactly like the 10-year-old Mr. Coffee grinder I gave to my neighbor in anticipation of having a nice new one. Also, none of these blade "grinders" actually grind anything. They chop. Like food processors, they chop, not grind. They only use the word "grinder" because it is more acceptable than saying "coffee chopper." Bottom line, believe the other reviews: this thing is a poorly-assembled, substandard version of the everyday, ordinary cheap coffee "grinders" out there. Buy one made in China; at least they have decent quality control.

reviews.reviewTitle: I detest having to assign a rating this low
reviews.reviewText:
The following four (4) sentences were already filled in but I agree with them!

1. Especially like that the blade “free wheels” so that even my brush can rotate while cleaning.
2. Seems based on my prev. Starbucks grinder but with a flourish or two. 3. The RPM may be higher and is a well balanced machine. 4. Thanks for offering in white..

But I have to add this:
After testing this one for a month or two I got the old Starbucks out. There's something about Mueller's metal cup that mounts the blades - despite cleaning with isopropyl alcohol it started to attract grounds that had to be brushed out each time. The blade hub was also affected. Further, the fine grind of which it's capable end up on the counter as well as the housing and inside the lid. More brushing req'd. Were I factory manager of the Muller I'd be proud to inspect the unit - it looks great. Using it daily's a different matter.

The Starbucks grinder's made in Slovenia - its metal cup seems to repel grounds - but maybe its
the coffee I use - Safeway Signature Kona (10%) Whole Bean - Medium Roast.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great grinder at a great price
reviews.reviewText: I love that this grinder, used only for coffee beans, is quiet and efficient. The beans are evenly ground in a matter of seconds. The reason I gave it only 4 stars is that the container is small. I can only make 8 cups, not a problem if that's all you will drink in a sitting. Also, the bean container is part of the base, so cleanup is not the easiest. Even though it's not "perfect" I would buy it again. For the price, it's a winner.

Bought this as a replacement for my Cuisinart DBM-8 that had broken down after 4 yrs. I wasn't using the fancier features of the DBM-8 (always had it set to the same fineness, pretty much always used the same small amount of beans) and the DBM-8 was bulky, difficult to clean, took up a lot of countertop space, didn't have a real burr in it, and encouraged you to leave beans out in the hopper. The Mueller is inexpensive, smaller, much lighter, and WAY quieter. Small size means it is easy to stow in a cabinet when not using. Not to mention that it is quick and easy to clean - just use a small brush in the grinder part and rinse out the plastic cap in the sink - no more disassembling the product to get at hidden areas with built-up ultra-fine coffee bean grounds (I hope). Because it is a "blade" grinder (FYI: the blades are dull, no risk of cutting yourself), you don't have much control over the grind size. Theoretically, you could make coarse grinds by 'pulsing' the beans for 2-3 seconds at a time, but I found this left some beans whole. It does do a pretty consistent medium/fine grind suitable for any standard drip coffee maker by just holding down the button for 10-15 seconds (time depends on quantity of beans), and it is much quieter than the DBM-8.

reviews.reviewTitle: Works Well Cleaning May Be An Issue
reviews.reviewText:
I bought this grinder for dried herbs, spices and hard things like roasted chickpeas. It works well.

The only shortcoming is that it can only be wiped out, not rinsed and it is difficult to get under the blades to clean. I had an old Braun that you could rinse (not immerse). Not sure how long it will take for stuff to build up.

I bought this grinder for fresh coffee beans.
So far it has held up well after grinding an entire bag of beans at once to see if it overheated or had any issue. So far it's a great buy and a great replacement for an old Braun I had that finally died. As far as the noise level goes, you need a strong powerful motor to do the job, and as a result it will make a lot of noise in the process. What do you expect? My dogs weren't afraid of it after finishing the first cup of beans, didn't overheat or catch fire like Lithium Ion cell batteries can, so it passes all of my important tests.

We first used this little grinder at a vacation house on the beach, when we accidentally bought beans instead of ground coffee. The owners of the house had stocked it well and we just loved this little machine. The fact that it is so quiet was our first delight. We have a high end coffee mill, but it is not quiet at all, so this was a nice surprise. The second thing we loved was that it ground our coffee beans into a very fine Turkish grind in no time at all, and, did not get hot and overworked like so many small grinders do. We immediately went online to find it on Amazon and found that the price was excellent. We are so happy with it that our over priced big grinder has gone into storage. This little machine does it all. I can't wait to try it on nuts for cooking. We highly recommend this little gem! Sellers were great as well. It came in two days and was packed well for shipping.

I really dislike the design of this grinder. The way the lid opens creates a small suction so when you open the top you will always leave behind some grinds on the counter. I like when the entire top is removable not just the lid. Because the entire top does not come detatched you have to grab the entire grinder and up-end it into your coffee maker. This makes the process really cumbersome and I now after grinding, I end up just turn the grinder upside down, give it a pound or two on the counter and remove the lid. That way I can just tap the lid filled with coffee grounds into my coffee maker instead of my entire grinder. Other than that the noise level is fine and the motor is very powerful. I always get the ground I want which is a fine grind. Three stars for the wonderful motor but minus 2 for terrible design.

Love this thing!!! I was hand grinding coffee for two every morning and potentially again later in the day every day. This makes it soooooo easy. It is relatively quiet, grinds coffee for up to 4ish people in a matter of seconds, and it grinds other things (I also grind flax seed and chia seed with it). It grinds quickly and consistently. Seems like it will last a long time.

5 month update:
Nothing to change from the first review. Still going just as strong as before and I grind a lot of coffee. Very good grinder and super glad I got it as opposed to continuing to hand grind.

reviews.reviewTitle: Easy to Use, Compact and Effective
reviews.reviewText: I bought this coffee grinder to coarse grind beans for a cold press. I put about a cup of beans in the grinder and snap on the cap. It is very easy to use. Like I mentioned, you just put however many beans you want in the grinder and then snap on the plastic lid. There is a gray mechanism attached to the plastic lid that you press down to start grinding. You have to hold down the mechanism to grind so you have a lot of control over the coarseness of your grind. It is pretty compact at about 7 inches of height and maybe 3 inches of width so it won't take up much kitchen space.

First grinder worked fine with coffee, but had problem grinding rye malt grains. Ground rye malt powder has very fine particles. Grinder managed to suck in ground powder into motor compartment. I guess there was issue with hermetic seal between blade compartment and motor compartment. I have shaken 2 cups of powder from vents at the bottom. Never seen anything like this before. Customer service said first unit is defective and sent new replacement grinder. I did not have to return old one. Second grinder works fine. Seller has very nice customer service and cares about product reputation a lot.

We love our Michigan coffee beans and wanted to be able to grind them on our annual winter vacation down south. I found the Mueller coffee grinder on Amazon, read the reviews and decided to give it a try. We love it! It grinds a large (10-12 cup) pot of beans in a single grind. It is amazingly quiet; so much quieter than our coffee pot grinder at home. It is aesthetically very attractive sitting on the counter. My only complaint is that I cannot wash the base in soap and water which is understandable because of the motor; it just makes it slightly more difficult to clean. I am very happy with my purchase of the Mueller Coffee Grinder and absolutely recommend it!

reviews.reviewTitle: For very small batches, very quiet
reviews.reviewText: My previous coffee grinder was a hands free and programmable, so I downgraded a bit with it, but still love this Mueller Austria HyperGrind Precision Electric Coffee Grinder very much. I usually grind a fresh batch of coffee every morning, just enough for two or three cups of coffee. This grinder is loud at first (not actually grinder, but the beans, while breaking) and then very quiet. For my turkish pot I grind coffee less than 30 recommended seconds and the coffee comes out very fine.

reviews.reviewTitle: Works as intended, but not for our purpose.
reviews.reviewText:
We didnt really look into coffee grinders this time, we just bought what was "#1 best seller" on amazon. This grinder came up and we were happy with the price so we got it. Its probably really ideal for casual use so I cant fault it, but we're making 10-20 coffees a day with it and have noticed some design flaws its not really ready for.

It wont measure and produce exact weight (14g) of beans for an espresso machine. You always end up with extra or need to blend twice. Both wasting time. I use this machine now for my cold brew attemps because the coffee amount is less strict.

Using it so much has made me feel its quite annoying to turn upside down to get the beans out. Again, if it were a solo use its fine but you need to grind, lid off, invert machine, then scrape / clean the excess beans. Its not as straight forward and comfortable as more expensive machines would be.

I do like this product, and would buy it for my friends and family, but I think it doesnt suit my specific need.

Update: definitely enjoying the grinder but the free peeler gift arrived broken. See photo. It’s definitely cooler than any peeler I’ve ever used and would like to use it.

The coffee grinder is great! I plan to use it strictly for my espresso beans for my morning cappuccino. No polluting it with nuts or anything else! I chose this one because it was Amazon’s top pick and had lots of great reviews plus it was a good price! I literally ordered standing in Bed, Bath & Beyond looking at their grinders!

reviews.reviewTitle: Finally, success after ordering four different grinders!
reviews.reviewText: The most important feature is the simplicity of cleaning it. Takes a simple swipe with a cloth inside and it is clean. This grinder lists for $19.97. The Bodum I ordered earlier lists for $85. The JavaPresse manual for $23.99 and the Gourmia for $24.99. A lot of money down the drain. But persistence has paid off for me in knowing I can grind my beans simply and then swipe the grinder clean. So easy to decide the grind by just pressing on the button longer for finer grind. Thank you Mueller for the grinder of my dreams.

Great grinder for whole coffee beans, but I’m sure you can use it for other culinary needs. Grinds ultra fine or any other size grind you need for your coffee maker depending on how long you keep the machine running. It runs like a mini food processor. The capacity is sufficient and I use the lid as a scooper. It’s very quick and efficient. I wouldn’t let water get in the bottom of the machine. Washes out easily with a sponge. I highly recommend it.

Bought back in early June of '16, used pretty much daily , up to several times a day, still grinding as wanted ( usually quite finely ground from frozen coffee beans), no failures so far. Not really noisy compared to the kitchen aid one we had a few years ago - now, that one was noisy!, worked well but it was all you heard while it was grinding.

Purchase was well worth the money and if yyou are looking for a dependable grinder, here it is.

Just received as promised, and I love it. It produces excellent espresso grind, and it is light, compact, elegant and quiet.

Those who prefer to grind coffee beans "in advance" may be a bit disappointed. It's small and 1 ground portion is just right for 2 measures of the espresso machine, single or double cup. If you want to have a supply for 3-5 days then be prepared to spend a few extra minutes. Surely, I'd rather have it as fresh as possible whenever possible, especially when I roast green coffee beans myself, but don't we all suffer from time deprivation in the weekday mornings :).

Absolutely worth every penny! This little guy is a powerhouse for grinding. We have our own business and grind dehydrated goods into powders for various cooking purposes as well as for our homemade spice blends. I've tried 3 other chopper/grinders, and been hugely disappointed. This does an absolutely beautiful job. Pictured is my tomato powder. The inner hopper is a bit of a pain to clean, but otherwise I love this grinder.

Bought whole beans and this grinder back in February then set out to use up my ground coffee. Now I have only used this twice and it quit working. Worse yet the warranty was only 30 days. Now I have whole beans and a paper weight. Most disappointing.

reviews.reviewTitle: Perfect for small smaces and produces consistent sized grinds.
reviews.reviewText: Perfect size for my busy countertops. The cup is easy to remove and easy to clean. This is an amazing little grinder and it has stayed sharp use after use. I have used it daily for about a month and it is consistent in the size of grinds it creates.

years ago I bought this same grinder so I thought I will upgrade. big mistake. my $100 grinder didn't even last a year meanwhile this one worked like mike mulligans steam shovel. great buy.THANK YOU SELLER!

reviews.reviewTitle: I was very pleased with the results
reviews.reviewText: I used my coffee grinder as soon as it arrived. I was very pleased with the results. I like fine grind, but my last grinder did not get the job done. This one did its job perfectly. I highly recommend this product.

A french press requires course ground beans, therefore a burr grinder is not needed. Mueller holds enough for a 34 oz french press (about 1/3 to 1/2 cup depending on bean). Use a brush to get all that ground goodness out, then a damp paper towel to clean. Noise is not as loud as most. 2 year warranty doubled when you email it in. Like I said in the title, stop looking and just buy this one.

reviews.reviewTitle: It sure beats cranking by hand
reviews.reviewText: Good value. Noise a lot less than you'd expect. Can be a bit messy when turning upside down to pop off the lid containing the grounds. Super simple operation without fancy bells and whistles. Just count the seconds mentally when grinding to figure out how fine/course you want - you'll figure out what you like.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great product at a great price
reviews.reviewText: So far so good. Loving this Mueller coffee grinder. Nice to be able to freshly grind my coffee beans as needed. Fit and finish are good and love the design. Good job on this one Mueller.

I have owned several coffee grinders over the years and I was actually a little doubtful on this one. The next morning changed all of that. I put my coffee beans in pressed the button and was amazed how quiet it was and how easy it is to control the grind. Our coffee was excellent! This is an outstanding product!!

As an example, I had been using an Oster to grind my seeds an nuts which are a major constituent of my diet. I timed the Oster. It took 30 seconds to grind the nutes to a very coarse powder. Then I timed the Mueller. It took 5 seconds to grind the nuts to a fine powder. The Mueller is much easier to use and to clean, it is much faster and does a much better job. The Mueller grinder definitely deserves a 5 star rating!

This grinder is very easy to use, does a great job of grinding your coffee beans and is very quiet. My only complaint is it can be a bit annoying to clean out I would recommend getting a little brush to dust out the grounds after each use. Other than that I would recommend this to others it's a great grinder for a good price!

reviews.reviewTitle: A solid and hard-working grinder, attractively-designed and reasonably-priced.
reviews.reviewText: I bought this to replace my old Black & Decker grinder, which disintegrated after over a decade of steady use. I am very happy with the Mueller grinder, which is fast, efficient and nice to look at. My only small caveat is that the grinds seem to stick to both the lid and the grinder itself, certainly more than with my previous grinder, meaning it requires more cleaning. But this is a minor issue and overall I am very satisfied with this product, and with the seller.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great coffee grinder, which will enhance you morning coffee.
reviews.reviewText:
This is a great coffee grinder and very easy to use. By decreasing or increasing the grind time allows you to change from a more coarse grind to a much finer espresso grind.

You can experiment with different types of coffee, how much you grind, and long you let it grind to develop your own custom blend.

Once you unplug it and are finished grinding you can very quickly wipe it clean with a damp paper towel.

I have been using the Muellar Austria Grinder for several months. The grinder has produced a consistent and uniform grind of coffee beans every time. When the grinder is activated it produces very low noise. Extremely easy to use with push button activation. Great product and I recommend it to others.
This effortlessly grinds coffee and nut in a quick manner. No need to look any further

reviews.reviewTitle: Works very well. Thought it would be easier to clean.
reviews.reviewText: It works very well and is simple to use. Since I never owned one of these before, I was a little surprised by the high pitched noise it makes. I'm sure that's normal for these grinders, but I have no other experience with anything like this. It scared my pets. Aside from that, I thought it would be easier to clean. You're not supposed to run it in water so cleaning is kind of a pain.

As advertised, it grinds coffee beans. I’ve ground about 7lbs of beans with it so far and feel it is well worth the price.
I’m not super happy that it’s white, but I have this neat little trick to take care of that: I put it away after I use it.
Seller provided excellent service as well.

This is a nice compact coffee bean grinder, that works like a charm. I put the beans in, pulsate it about 3 times, then actually grind the beans for about 10 seconds and I have fresh ground coffee.
The only con I have is it is hard to clean where the blades are, I was afraid I was going to cut myself.

reviews.reviewTitle: Sound less and the finest coffee
reviews.reviewText: It works perfectly well, I was impressed of how fine I could grind the coffee and so easily. It fairly makes any noise the only thing I have to figure out is how to clean the interior of it, but I am very happy with this purchase!

We like our Mueller Coffee bean grinder. We just started drinking French Press and love the ease of using this grinder. The reservoir is perfect for doing a small amount. The noise level is surprisingly not bad. Our previous one had such a high pitched noise, it hurt my ears. I haven't needed to clean our grinder since we only use it for coffee. It is small enough that we can take it with us on vacations, too!!!

Sleek design and does not take up a lot of counter space. The sound it makes when in use is just what you would expect. It does make a sound but it grinds whole beans to a very fine espresso consistency very, very quickly. It should not be used for nuts or spices as indicated in the instructions.

reviews.reviewTitle: I'm very pleased with this item!
reviews.reviewText: I'm very pleased with this item, it does an awesome job of grinding my cumin, fennel and flax seeds. I would encourage my friends and family to purchase it.

Durable, quiet, sharp. High quality. I've had several grinders before and this one is, by far, the most efficent and quiet one I've owned so far.

My needs are small: chia seeds, flax seeds and coffee. But, this is standing up to daily use quite well.

This is a great little grinder. We bought it after the one we had finally quit on us. It’s quite a bit quieter than our last one and grinds up our coffee beans fairly quickly as well. Before I had to grind at least a couple times and shake it before it would become the consistency we needed for drip coffee. But this it only takes a few seconds. So far I’m very pleased with the product! Hopefully it will outlast our former grinder as well!

So far so good! It's quiet, efficient! Made short work of some great Italian beans, in moments, and surprisingly quiet. Perfect grind, feels high quality. Thank you for taking a lot of stress of grinder noise from me and a gaggle of kitties who just entered the world!

It does a great job of grinding my coffee beans, but am surprised that the price was reduced by $5.00 since I purchased it yesterday?? I find this price reduction as a total surprise and would be grateful to receive a $5.00 credit on my account.

reviews.reviewTitle: A very good coffee grinder, recommended!
reviews.reviewText: I used other grinders, this one is much better. The combination of blade shape and container shape make a perfect grinding. You can see the movement of ground coffee, they are floating and become finer and finer. The seconds are exactly what they put in their menu, for me 15~20 seconds the taste is perfect. Also it supports big quantity of grinding -12 cups, it did. Very good grinder, recommended.

Handy little machine but I have a few gripes. There is no easy way to clean. There is no easy way to get coffee out once done. Could have used a removable inner cup in my estimation. But it does work well albeit there are no variable speed options for fine or coarse.

Works as promised.
Simple to use and easy to clean.
Well made with nice build/component quality.
I found it to be exceptionally quiet but it is a mechanical grinder so it will make noise when processing, but not excessively.

The coffee grinder arrived on time. I immediately put it to use grinding some coffee beans, I was very pleased with the results. Perfect consistency in just a few seconds. I highly recommend this product.

It does what it was made to do. You add beans, it grinds them. If you don't tap off the cover it can be a bit messy but most grinders have that problem. It's easy to use. My only small complaint is that the blade can't be removed to aid in getting the grounds out but that's a very minor thing.

reviews.reviewTitle: Easy to use, reliable, nice grind.
reviews.reviewText: I really like this coffee grinder. It isn't complicated, very straight forward -- just put your beans in, set the lid on and press it down until you've achieved the texture you want. Turn it over so the grounds are in the cup - it makes it easy to in turn pour the ground coffee into your coffeemaker.

Works fine. Not sure I'd be able to taste the difference between supposedly more mono-disperse grounds from a burr grinder versus this blade type. Couldn't justify the price difference.

This seems high quality construction and is way quieter than the last one that we had (kitchen aid?)

reviews.reviewTitle: Very easy to use, good quality yet affordable coffee grinder!
reviews.reviewText: Got it yesterday, plugged it in after reading the instructions, got my coffee beans ground to a fine level (15 seconds of grinding) to get me a nice espresso. The unit was easy to use and easy to clean. Customer support is great as well with fast and friendly personnel assisting.

reviews.reviewTitle: Extremely unreliable, don't waste your money
reviews.reviewText: Purchased one and used 3-4 times. Than it just stopped working. Contacted the seller and was offered a replacement which arrive in few days. Guess what, the replacement worked only 2 times and, just as the first one, stopped working. My old Braun still works fine, just too old, wanted something newer. Don't waste your time and money on this one.

reviews.reviewTitle: Perfect size, perfect price. Overall , great purchase.
reviews.reviewText: I was in search of a small grinder to replace my old one. After reading the reviews I decided to order this one. The price was perfect and so was the size. It is a great purchase. Grinds the coffee beans perfectly and makes very little noise. Only downside is it does not grind large quantities so I have to grind small batches and store in an airtight container. Aside from that i have nothing negative to say.

Its a wonderful little grinder. It can make enough for about 4 cups of coffee depending on how strong you like it. I usually blend about 6-7 tablespoons of coffee at a time. It can grind the beans very fine or more coarse according to preference.

reviews.reviewTitle: Use a pestle and mortar rather than this.
reviews.reviewText:
This thing will barely grind enough for 1 cup(I like strong coffee)

Really inconvenient to transfer grinds from machine to coffee maker.

It does grind coffee beans, but I would buy any other product.

This grinder is surprisingly quiet and quick to produce aromatic, superfine coffee grounds. Highly recommend! Try grinding some Dragonfly Coffee beans with this spectacular product- Leam Hammer Espresso or Crema Dolce. Delicious!

Smaller than I thought, so have to grind coffee twice. Also, have to turn machine upside down to get coffee out. My last one unscrewed from grinder, so you just turned the cup over. Just found this way weird

My coffee grinder broke so we bought this one. It grinds less than my old one and you have to hold the button down while you grind. It’s a no frills coffee grinder but it’s getting the job done. I’m satisfied with my purchase.

reviews.reviewTitle: Simple, but does a great job
reviews.reviewText: This is a simple grinder but I love it. I love how small it is but even though it handles a good amount of grains. Works reaaaaally fast, even if you want a fine grind. You just have to push the lid a little bit and starts to work. It's easy to clean, it's noisy but not as noisy as other grinders. I love it.

I love Austrian quality and was happy to find Mueller HyperGrind in the USA. It works well, as it should. Glad, I got it. I will purchase a second one, the same - this time for grinding nuts and poppy seeds. Don't want to get it mixed up with coffee flavors.

reviews.reviewTitle: Very nice! I don't find this grinder to be noisy ...
reviews.reviewText: Very nice! I don't find this grinder to be noisy - it's quieter than my old one. It grinds quickly. My only caveat is that it is a little messier. Do not empty into the cap as the directions call for because that is a disaster waiting to happen! I keep an inch wide artist brush just for cleaning the grinder insides and the cap.
Less than a year old and it stopped working. Enjoyed it prior to this.
Love this product! Easy to use and doesn't take up room on the kitchen counter. Definitely reccomend

reviews.reviewTitle: Very quiet and the perfect grind!
reviews.reviewText: Haven’t had it very long, but I love how much more quiet this grinder is than others that I’ve bought. It seems well made. It grinds my coffee beans perfectly without leaving any whole beans. The only downside I can think of is that it’s not the easiest to clean because nothing except for the cap is removable.

I bought this electric grinder to replace another grinder that stop working after many years. Based on customer reviews,I decided to try this one. I'm glad I did. The collection container is quite large and It ground the beans perfectly. I hope it lasts as long as the one I replaced.

Awesome thank you! I just used it and it works perfectly, it smelled so grinding fresh beans that I made a pot of coffee at 4 in the afternoon, my girlfriend has some hand picked beans from Uganda I can’t wait to grind some for coffee in the morning!

reviews.reviewTitle: Wonderful, high quality device perfect for my needs!
reviews.reviewText: This is sturdy, well made, operates beautifully. I bought it to grind flax seeds, and they were done beautifully, in an instant. I LOVE when a product is well made, and works like it is supposed to...and the price is really, really good for the quality.

I bought this last month and this grinder lasted only 3 uses before it died. Very poor motor! I used it to grind a few herbs for tea so I guess that it would break sooner on coffee beans. Very disappointed!
I am extremely pleased with Mueller Austri Coffee Grinder. I find it very easy to use and clean. Your customer service department provided outstanding service to me and sending me the bonus peeler.

What a find. This coffee grinder truly met and quite frankly exceeded all of my expectations. I needed a spare grinder other than the one I have because I suffer from extreme pain and I found a whole bean coffee that is infused with CBD which helps very much with my problems and not wanting to subject anyone else in my house to this it is perfect. It works better than the grinder built into my very expensive coffee maker. Thank you.
This is quick and easy to use - I just started getting into cold brewing coffee. My only complaint is that it's a bit difficult to clean and get all of the grounds out while keeping the machine dry.

Its hard to get a consistent grind when you fill it up fairly high... its good for the price though; but next go around ill probably just spend the extra money and get a grinder with settings for "French press", "espresso", "paper filter", "metal filter", etc.
This is like getting fresh coffee. This grinder is so simple to use and easy tunderstand

It's a simple but powerful apparatus. Can grind beans from coarse to fine depending how long you grind it for. Good quality and easy to use, no unnecessary buttons or accessories. Just recently purchased, but have been happy with it so far!
Nice and small so it won't take up precious space on your counter top! Grinds to perfection! And the freshly ground coffee beans truly make a better cup of coffee! Buy it! You won't regret it!!

Inexpensive little wonder. Grinds perfect, powerful, robust, and small. I use it only for coffee beans. I am writing this review based on this same grinder that I purchased about 6 months ago. This new one is a gift for my sister in-law

Don't let the name fool you.
It's made in China (prc) means people republic of china they are using European names.
This product is 30 percent more than similar product

Truly a quieter grinder. Had others sounded like gerbil skulls in a blender. On the Mueller, the unit is quieter than the coffee beans. Grind is fast and consistent.
I've ground coffee with my Mueller every day for over 6 months and i recommend THIS grinder!
Very easy to use and versatile grinding sizes possible. I only wish it collected the coffee for removal. I usually just turn it upside down to get the coffee out. Even with that I still like it.

Works well and looks good. I just wish it had a retractable cord or an indentation on the bottom where I could wind the cord (like my old one which just broke). Now I have one more cord visible on my counter, even though I was able to fold and tie it up as much as possible between the grinder and the outlet.

This is a cheap piece of garbage. Branded as Mueller: Austria, it's made in China. No speed variation, no timer for grind. It's definitely not quiet. Poor fitting lid results in coffee grounds everywhere. I purchased it quickly cause it was Amazon's Choice. No thanks, Amazon.

This little machine works great... I dont really use it for the intended purpose but... We use it to grind up dirt in the lab I work at... we were spending hours with a mortar and pestle but now we are done in seconds... thanks for such a great product!

I'm such a big fan of this thing. It's so satisfying to see my coffee beans turn into dust and release that amazing aroma! It's so quick, and not nearly as loud as I expected. I DO wish I could wash it with soap, but I'm still very happy with this.
I don't use this for grinding coffee...I use it for grinding nuts that I use in my recipes. Works like a dream, easy to clean and the nuts are the perfect consistency. Stores away compactly.

So far so good, this grinder has substantially more power (200 watts) than my last one (not Mueller) and seems pretty robust. Only time will tell if it holds up, but my first 5 grinds have gone painlessly and I look forward to good espresso in the morning using this machine.

Just got this coffee grinder in the mail from Amazon. I was surprised at how deep the grinding chamber was. It handled a FULL chamber of whole beans just fine, ground even faster than our previous model, and it was so quiet, could barely hear it operate. I am so happy we chose this grinder!
I bought this to use to grind toasted spices for my spice mixes. It gets them fine enough for use very quickly. The chamber is large enough for the chunks of cinnamon stick in my curry powders.

Used it right out of the box and have now used it 4-5 times and am very pleased how quiet it is and does the job perfectly. Most important read the instructions how many seconds to get your correct grind for your taste.

I love the design, one machine for all grinding needs in the kitchen -- save the space, save the money. Even better, easy cleaning which is unlike other traditional grinders. Great for coffee beans or spices. Very easy to use.
Easily the best coffee grinder you could buy. Easy to use and amazing quality.

reviews.reviewTitle: I guess this is fine if all you grind is one thing and it's ...
reviews.reviewText: I used it for grinding flaxseeds. My only complaint is that the cup isn't removable so it's slightly problematic to clean. I guess this is fine if all you grind is one thing and it's dry but I wouldn't dream of using it for anything wet.

I bought this grinder specifically for spices and put it to work right away. It worked very well, even chopping up pieces of cinnamon stick without complaining. The motor does start to get hot in a short time, but I gave it a rest now and then and it was fine.

reviews.reviewTitle: Easy to use and easy to clean
reviews.reviewText: I wanted to wait a bit to see if Mueller grinder matches effectiveness of previous product, that stopped working after 20+ years. I'm 100% satisfied after several "grinds". I just use it for coffee beans. It grinds to my preferred consistency.

reviews.reviewTitle: Died after 4 months of light use
reviews.reviewText: We don't grind beans very often, but when we do it means we are out of pre-ground coffee. What a disappointment that after 4 month this coffee grinder no longer works. Look for something else.

Of all the many different coffee grinders I've used over my life, about 8, this is by far the quietest. And just like every coffee grinder I've ever used during my life, it's not possible to use without making a mess each and every time you pull the lid off.

reviews.reviewTitle: A Grinder that's easy to use and does the job quickly!
reviews.reviewText: As a Coffee Grinder, the Mueller HyperGrind Mill does a Beautiful job quickly. We are new to grinding coffee beans and this Grinder does a Beautiful job while keeping it simple to use and adjust. We just, simply put, Love our Grinder!!!!

Like its simplicity, quietness and ability to grind into fine powder in a short time. The coffee grind kind of clumped up in the bottom corners and up the sides a little and did not come out unless stirred up. I give it 4 1/2 stars for now. Time will tell more.

reviews.reviewTitle: I like that it is compact and doesn't take much space
reviews.reviewText: I like that it is compact and doesn't take much space. Works great and love the fact that it can be used for other purposes than just grinding your coffee beans. Easy to use and would be a great inexpensive gift to give.

I was hesitant to buy a gringer cause I didnt want to waste money. But I love fresh ground coffee in the mornings and my old manual one took sooo long. This product is super fast and easy. I can literally use it while my crazy toddler sleeps.

I bought this mainly for grinding spices. I didn't realize how deep the chamber is. You don't normally need a deep chamber grinder to grind spices. So i end up having to run it longer. The motor is quite. So it's been ok to run it longer so far.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great for fine flax seeds too!
reviews.reviewText:
I usually don’t write reviews but I am impressed with this grinder
I tried several others to try to grind my flax seeds and this is the only one that did he job.
It’s important to grind them right before you put them in your smoothie and not buy tues seeds ground already
So I’m happy!

reviews.reviewTitle: Grinder burned out. Barely 4 months old.
reviews.reviewText: Today my Mueller coffee grinder burned out. I purchased the grinder in July 2018. Today was the ninth time I used the grinder. VERY disappointing.
Very happy with this little grinder, does the job done well and it's easy to clean. I am using it to grind dehydrated cat food, great little helper.

reviews.reviewTitle: I love it! It is so quiet
reviews.reviewText: I love it! It is so quiet! It grinds really consistently and I can get it really fine which i like..plus the grinder doesnt get hot which is fabulous!

reviews.reviewTitle: very quiet and fine, even grind
reviews.reviewText: Used only for coffee beans so far, but this was very quiet. I like the style also. It doesn't have a removable bowl for easiest cleaning, but still wiped down easily.

reviews.reviewTitle: Ok cuppa Joe. Grind fresh beans Stat.
reviews.reviewText: This Coffee mill does the job. You can watch the beans spinning and count the seconds to your desired grind. Turn upside down, carefully drop the filled cap and put into coffee maker. Voila.
Wow! Blown away by how quiet and efficient this is! Ground my beans in no time! Super quiet! I’m in love with this! Highly recommend!
If you want a coffee grinder that does just that and does it well, this is the product for you. It is well designed, well made and as simple to use as it gets.

reviews.reviewTitle: Not Durable- died on me after 1.5 mths
reviews.reviewText: Product stopped working after 1.5 mths. Need a replacement. Amazon window has closed

It works well so far and does exactly what I want it to do, and for a reasonable price. There's really no down size to this as it makes the necessary amount of coffee required for me and my wife each morning. It's small and has a solid feel as it grinds. I will probably get a second for spices!

reviews.reviewTitle: Great start to a great cup of coffee!
reviews.reviewText: This is all that and more for a great price. Little grinder is priced right and grinds course or fine with one button. Very happy with purchase!
I bought this as a backup grinder to keep at the office. It became my primary grinder because it grinds twice as fast as my other one. It also has twice the capacity and cost slightly less.
Nice grinder. Arrived quickly. Quieter than my last couple of grinders. Fairly shallow cup which makes cleaning easier. Will grind coarse or more fine, depending on how long you let it run.
Grinds my coffee beans like it said it would. Wish I got the black to hide the coffee grounds I don’t get out. Was a little loud at first but I’m used to it now.

reviews.reviewTitle: Not as good as the reviews--meh..
reviews.reviewText:
Pros: quiet
Cons: Not as user-friendly as other grinders in price range. Not as precis in grind as a Krups that I had prior.
Very pleased with the coffee grinder. Works as expected and ground from course to fine with no problem. I would recommend to a friend.

Enjoy using this coffee grinder to make fresh aromatic coffee.
Wish it came in more colors but white goes with most kitchens.
Oh and it's from Austria so that's cool.

Works as advertised... I use it solely for coffee though. It’s a solid machine and is much quieter than I expected it to be. That’s a plus considering it’s being used in a office environment. I can’t really speak to the durability yet as I haven’t had it but for a day. I can say that it arrived quickly and was priced fairly.
I use it to grind up herbs and other non-coffee bean items. I am very happy with this purchase. It works just as advertised.
It works. My previous grinder was Hamilton, it worked just as well. I got this on Prime Day. Like all coffee grinders, a pain to clean.

reviews.reviewTitle: this was advertised as something easy to use with fair capacity...they are right!
reviews.reviewText: husband was very pleased with his birthday present. he didn't expect it to be that good, but he was really pleased how well it worked
I only just got this. So far, it works better than other grinders I've had. It is smooth and quick, and has good capacity,
I’m drinking my first cup as I write this! It was easy to use and fresh coffee always tatse awesome. I accidentally threw the insructions out and still figured it out in about 30 seconds

I purchased this coffee bean grinder based on the reviews, and so far, so good! Great grinder at a great price! It's sturdy and performs well, and it's nice to look at. What more could you want? Love it!

reviews.reviewTitle: Noisy for its size but works like a charm
reviews.reviewText: The whole size of it is pretty small compared to what I thought it would be but not in a bad way. That little sucker is loud though! It is a small top to blend beans in but a little bit goes a long way. Overall, I recommend!
Better than the cheaper one from a no name company that broke after about 80 uses. This seems much sturdier ( of course there's no way to grind coffee beans quietly).

It grinds coffee well. This is best for daily grinds for personal or 2-person consumption. If you want to grind more than 3 tablespoons of beans at a time, you will want to consider a different grinder.
This is a great coffee grinder. My only complaint is having a detachable compartment that removes blades for cleaning. Not a big deal, either way it's great at what it does.
After a couple of tries you will find that sweet spot for your perfectly ground coffee beans. Great grinder.
works great and is more quiet than my old model. I'm very happy with this purchase. I like the shape, too; it seems to be more stable than the typical round/slightly oval shape

This thing works great! It only takes a few seconds to get my coffee fully ground every morning and the design makes it easy to get into the coffee maker and it is easily cleaned. I would buy more products from this company in the future.
For the price I guess I expected it to brew my coffee too :) Not worth the extra $ over the cheaper brands - it just grinds coffee folks. nothing special.
I used this coffee grinder two times. The second time I used it, it overheated and stopped working.

reviews.reviewTitle: Fast, powerful and silent. Perfect for personal use.
reviews.reviewText: I like your grinder because it grinds coffee quickly and depending on the degree of grinding you just have to leave it for a few more seconds. I use this grinder exclusively for coffee beans.
Fantastic little grinder! No fancy grind options, but does a nice job fully grinding coffee beans.
love the power and speed of this thing! i use it for flax seeds for mixing with my foods or smoothies. would have loved it to be orange, or at least stainless. but it does do a perfect job!
Very nice grinder-high quality and great price-I would buy again-I highly recommend this grinder

reviews.reviewTitle: Does a good job. Small design nitpick.
reviews.reviewText: I decided I wanted to start grinding my own coffee for French press method brewing and settled on this straightforward unit. It does a great job grinding the beans and after an initial clatter isn't too loud at all. My one complaint is that it's a bit of a challenge to clean well. In addition to working with the blade the metal bowl at the base only goes up about halfway on the sides, creating a seam between it and the plastic before the plastic then meets the cap. Instead of using a "damp cloth" as recommended, I've been using a cheap toothbrush to ensure I'm getting as much of the last batch out as possible. It's not optimal, but it does pass the time while waiting for my freshly ground coffee to steep.
Great for the price! I bought this because of the number of five star reviews and the price point. It has worked well.

I really like this coffee bean grinder. For 2 decades I used Krups but I decided to change to the Mueller Hypergrind and I'm glad I did. It has a nice size well to hold the beans. The lid is a nice and big so I can see in it really well. It grinds the beans extremely fast and very evenly and it's also very quiet with no vibrating. It's way better than Krups. So far I love it.

reviews.reviewTitle: Does very well, but small amount at a time.
reviews.reviewText: Didn't believe the reviews about the smaller grinding reservoir. For our sized coffee maker it takes two batches. So, not using it as a coffee grinder. However it is excellent as a spice grinder. Highly recommend it for spices.
Died after about ten uses. Used it only to grind flax seeds so used it occasionally over two years.
I am pleased with this coffee grinder. It grinds beans quickly, is easy to wipe clean and is not overly noisy.
Great grinder...........I've already used it to ground coffee beans and some almonds. Worked wonderfully and was super easy to clean.

I primarily use this grinder for herbs and spices. I've never used it for coffee. For these purposes it works best when grinding large quantities rather than small amounts or you will end up with uneven grind size. When grinding down to fine powder, particulates will escape below where the power button is depressed. Other than that minor issue, I am pleased with the product for the price.
This is a perfect size. I used it for the first time and it is bigger than I thought. I love it. Will only by coffee beans from now on
Works great! Not too noisy considering what it is used for. Prefect for grinding enough coffee for a day or two.
I sent this back after one use. Way too noisy. Actually caused ear discomfort for my wife and me.
My dad loves coffee so what better gift to give than a coffee grinder. He absolutely loves it.

Easy to use, clean & store.
Lovely design, quick grinding with minimum noise.
Could/should have a retractable cord like other ginders.
Its very handy. Works super well. Only difficulty is cleaning it since you can't clean it with water. Only wet tissue can be used such doesn't help remove stains of spices.
Inexpensive and basic, but works well and quality appears very good. I use it for drip coffee. 15 seconds of grind.
I grind my coffee for each pot I make, so this is the perfect size. Love it...
Simple easy to use product. Does the job nicely and short enough to fit in my cabinet.

reviews.reviewTitle: So Far So Good Great Value
reviews.reviewText: Works for me. I like it. I have a french press. Remember it is only for coffee, not for nuts.
Grind coffee for coffee press— perfect, no more groungs getting caught in filter.
I am a coffee snob. I grind my beans twice a day. Nice quality and durable.
I drink a lot of coffee and prefer to grind my own beans. Needed a new grinder and this one works perfectly.

reviews.reviewTitle: It's the name that sells it
reviews.reviewText:
This seems to be a solid coffee grinder. No bells and whistles. It just quietly gets the job done.

And I've received many smiles and compliments on the brand name.

reviews.reviewTitle: It's good. Good price. Does the job.
reviews.reviewText: Basic grinder. Could have been made easier to clean - i.e. make the blade assembly removable.
This is a great grinder, easy to use, and makes quick work of grinding up coffee grounds super fine for a great espresso!
I really liked the product. I am not having any issue while using it.
This is the second grinder . I use this new one for coffee and herbs. My wife uses hers for nuts and such.

reviews.reviewTitle: Perfect for very finely ground beans!
reviews.reviewText: We love that this product is easy to clean, does not make a mess while in use, is only moderately loud, and lets us grind our beans to an extra fine level. We actually returned a more expensive burr grinder that was messy and ineffective. This product is exactly what we were looking for!
I am pleased with the performance of this grinder. It works just as advertised.
I purchased this grinder for coffee, but equally as important seasoning and spices and it works fantastic!
Have only used it a few times but works like a charm. No complaints and would definitely recommend
Great gadget. Works for to my pleasure. I use it to grind my beans for my cold brew
Bought this for grinding coffee beans, but I’m sure my wife will use it for chopping nuts. Works really well.

reviews.reviewTitle: Arrived a day late, looks like a quality, well made product.
reviews.reviewText: Other than the arrival, the product is well made and will be used at our cabin to keep the morning coffee fresh.
I am so happy I bought this. I really looked at reviews before ordering. This is nice and quiet. It does a great job grinding up the beans. I highly recommend.
This works very well. Grinds really fast and easy to use. Works very well for what I need it for! Would highly recommend!
Very hard to clean. Almost impossible to clean because the base doesnt detach. I feel like it will not last for a long time because it will get dirty. Disappointed at the poor design
Simple, easy and quiet. Wow. Makes short work of the beans for my morning espressos.
Hubby loves it (I'm not a coffee drinker) and it's only kind of loud when it first starts, but quickly gets quiet.
Good product..inexpensive and works perfectly. Very convenient and easy to use ..perfect for 1.or 2 cups

reviews.reviewTitle: I just wish it had little rubber feet on the bottom to stop it from sliding around the counter so easily.
reviews.reviewText: This grinder does the job, I just wish it had little rubber feet on the bottom to stop it from sliding around the counter so easily.
nice little grinder but didn't grind coffee as finely as i wanted. WIll use it for spices instead

reviews.reviewTitle: better than the top selling cuisinart on
reviews.reviewText: Efficint, swift, effective, this Muller will grind on until the job is done. Of all the grinders I have owned, without doubt, this one is the strongest and judiciously grinds each bean, quietly, without any pomp and circumstance. The Mueller is made in Austria and can not be intimitaded by those cheap, flashy grinders without substance.
Very easy to use, good price. A little noisy but nothing major.
I like the size and the clear cap. I actually bought it for grinding spices. It does a great job. Great product and price.
This item is amazing. Does a great job and very quiet when operating. Love it so far!!
It ground the coffee fast, and is relative to our previous grinder, it works quietly.

Small footprint, easy to adjust how finely ground you want the beans. Perfect with my french press! Not the easiest thing to clean, but not a big concern since it's always used with coffee. Like nearly everything else, this is made in China.
So far it is working great. The kids said this make the best coffee!
Just got this grinder. I like how it's easy to use. It is small and easy to bring it for traveling. That's the main reason I bought it.
Just got this yesterday - works great so far. We'll see in a few months... Thanks!
I used this machine to crush apricot seeds. I'm very impressed! Did it's job quickly with no hesitation.

reviews.reviewTitle: How to take care of it.
reviews.reviewText: Only run it at 8 seconds per grind. Noise isn't too bad for early in the morning. Clean up is easy, just wipe with a paper towel.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great addition to my coffee corner
reviews.reviewText: Product grinds my coffee beans perfectly.
Just what a coffee grinder does. Also working on the investigation of Donald Trump so that’s an added bonus.

reviews.reviewTitle: Does a good job grinding your coffee beans.
reviews.reviewText: This Mueller HyperGrind does a great job grinding coffee beans. Wish it held more beans. A little smaller than I am use too.

reviews.reviewTitle: Love it. I had a Krups that finally died ...
reviews.reviewText: Love it. I had a Krups that finally died and this seemed to be a similar shape and size, but it is a LOT more powerful. It's efficient, quiet and gets the job done quickly. I definitely recommend The Mueller.

My opinion on the grinder is that it is small but functional. It will take time to see if the product will last (plastic seems a bit light and delicate) but for now I am satisfied.

***Update

I feel compelled to add that my brother took this grinder to work and I never saw it again. I used it twice with no issues. It died for him first try in front of co-workers basically still brand new.

The vendor contacted me on Facebook and asked me to message them Feedback on my experience for a free item and I messaged them on Facebook (copied what I had already reviewed on Amazon).

THEN

The Vendor asked me to please review on Amazon and I let them know I had already posted my review.

Actually did get the small free gift from then (delicate potato grinder) however while they did not say give me a great review or no free gift I can see how that applies pressure on some individuals.

For me? I had no idea about what the free gift was but I was interested in their practices and they look legit but I would be dubious about some positive reviews. Some people would do anything for a freebie.

I was able to grind things like coffee, pepper corns & other spices.
I don't believe you would get the smooth consistency desired for baby food with this product.

qAndA.question: Is it washable
qAndA.answer: It can be wiped out by hand. It is not dishwasher safe

qAndA.question: Is this a blade or burr grinder?
qAndA.answer: blade

qAndA.question: How many cups does it grind?
qAndA.answer: I make 2 cups from one grind. But I think you can make a little more.

qAndA.question: Do coffee grinds get inside the motor underneath?
qAndA.answer: Yes

qAndA.question: Does this machine work for 220v?
qAndA.answer: I believe you would have to use a converter for your particular country. Plugging it in to a 110 outlet might fry it or cause damage... Best to check with manufacturer.

qAndA.question: The product description says "Austria." Is this made in China?
qAndA.answer: Mine says China

qAndA.question: Does itgrind egg shells?
qAndA.answer: I have another (older) grinder that I use exclusively for eggshells and it worked great. My Mueller grinder is a dedicated grinder for dehydrated herbs & vegetables and grinds them to a powder, so I would feel comfortable in saying yes - this WILL grind egghells to a powder.

qAndA.question: Hi , is it 110v or 220v for mueller austria hypergrind precision electric coffee grinder mill?
qAndA.answer: It is 120v and 130w

qAndA.question: In ounces how much can you grind at one time?
qAndA.answer: Probably one or two ounces. Not a whole lot but enough.

qAndA.question: what is the watts?
qAndA.answer: The unit draws about 1.1 ampere which means it consumes about 130 watts of power.

qAndA.question: is the blade part washable and detachable?
qAndA.answer: I don’t think so. I clean with uncooked rice, as I read somewhere. Wipe with towel.

qAndA.question: will this grind flax seeds and chia seeds? thanks
qAndA.answer: I think it would haven't tried anything but coffee

qAndA.question: Has anyone used this to grind up pills?
qAndA.answer: I have not used this grinder to grind pills. However I have used it to grind seeds and it does an excellent job. I am certain grinding pills would not be a problem. Seed shells are much tougher than pills.

qAndA.question: How many ounces of coffee beans can it grind at one time.?
qAndA.answer: Not sure exact amounts, however I ground a pound of beans in like 4 rounds? So like a quarter pound. It is perfect for home use

qAndA.question: how many Watts the motor is?
qAndA.answer: I don’t know. You can look that up in the product description

qAndA.question: I used it three times and now it won’t work. What can I do?
qAndA.answer: Return it and explain the reason.

qAndA.question: I've read the listing repeatedly and I'm not seeing anywhere that a capacity is stated...Anyone know the capacity?
qAndA.answer: I measured out up to 7 tablespoons of whole beans of coffee will fit in the grinder; maximum.

qAndA.question: where do the ground beans gather? How do you get the beans out of the machine? Thanks.
qAndA.answer: Gather at top. The top is used as a cup.

qAndA.question: Can I grind a small quantity of flaxseed to use only for a few days instead of the whole bag? Thanks
qAndA.answer: Yep!!!

qAndA.question: que fuerza tiene elmotor, es duradero?
qAndA.answer: Sólo he tenido esto durante unas semanas, así que no puedo decir.

qAndA.question: Has anyone used to grind beans for espresso?
qAndA.answer: Yes. And it does a great job!! I’m very happy with my decision to purchase!!

qAndA.question: Could i grind up dehydrated foods in this? Such as dehydrated fruits, veggies, plants etc
qAndA.answer: Yes

qAndA.question: Can you set it for a particular grind?
qAndA.answer: No. Push the button and the blades turn. Stop pushing the button and the blades stop. The top lid is clear so you can easily see how ground up the beans are.

qAndA.question: what is the grinder capacity ?
qAndA.answer: about one cup whole beans ( this is a guess since I don't actually measure)

qAndA.question: Is this a burr grinder?
qAndA.answer: It’s a blade grinder.

qAndA.question: How many ounces of coffee beans can it grind at one time.?
qAndA.answer: haven't weight it, the quantity is about 1/3 cup of whole beans

qAndA.question: is this a ceramic burr or blade?
qAndA.answer: Metal blade. Not burr.

qAndA.question: what is the grinding capacity?
qAndA.answer: I would say 1 cup

qAndA.question: Is the inner cup removable?
qAndA.answer: No. I grind the coffee then turn it upside down so the coffee falls in the lid and then use the lid to dump it in the French press. It works great and it takes up so much less room on the counter top than my previous one (different brand) which burned out in 4 months. It is also quicker and quieter than the other brand.

qAndA.question: Does this grinder work for spices?
qAndA.answer: I’m not sure. It grinds the coffee pretty fine so I imagine it would

qAndA.question: How noisy is this grinder?
qAndA.answer: It's very quiet to me

qAndA.question: How do you wash the inner cup?
qAndA.answer: Remove the coffee cover and wash in warm sudsy water

qAndA.question: Does this unit have overload protection? Will it reset if if gets too hot?
qAndA.answer: This is a good question for the manufacturer. I use it to grind coffee beans, which takes about fifteen seconds per batch. I've never experienced "overload" or it getting "hot." If you use it according to manufacturer instructions, I think it will have a long life. My previous grinder lasted over 20 years.

qAndA.question: Is the jar removable?
qAndA.answer: I assume you mean the clear plastic top. If so, then yes it's removeable both to load and unload the grinds. And the whole unit is intended to turn upside down so that the grinds dump into the clear plastic lid so you can in turn, pour the grinds into your coffee maker.

qAndA.question: Are replacement blades available?
qAndA.answer: I don't know. I don't even know if one could access the blades to replace.

qAndA.question: Is it supposed to fall apart right out of the box?
qAndA.answer: The one we received was fine. We use it everyday and love it.

qAndA.question: how many ounces of beans can you load?
qAndA.answer: This is a small grinder. I use 3 coffee scoops and it will grind enough for a pot with a little extra

qAndA.question: is it made in austria?
qAndA.answer: Unfortunately it’s made in China.

qAndA.question: What is the capacity?
qAndA.answer: exactly, sorry, not sure. I use a espresso machine for my java. i use 3 spoonful and that's what starts me in the morning. in my family, we only use what we need so, we grind every morning. i do know that if you use too much, it will spill all over the place when you open. on the quality side, its an excellent machine!… see more

qAndA.question: If you did not grind it fine enough, can you regrind it finer ????
qAndA.answer: You can grind as much as you need and regrind, just make sure to shake it so as to loosen the contents from grind to grind

qAndA.question: Que voltaje es?
Can you use water to rinse this machine? Any water resistance?
qAndA.answer: I'M sorry not to know about this. I haven't tried to rinseit with water. It would probably work, but i'm so happy with it i'd rather just wipe it out with a towel after using.

qAndA.question: Does this grind chia and flaxseeds?
qAndA.answer: I haven't used this for seeds, but it's great at grinding coffee, so I'm sure it will grind other things as well.

qAndA.question: Is this grinder made in Austria?
qAndA.answer: Consensus seems to be China.

qAndA.question: How fine is the fine grind? I understand that this is not a magazine quality picture but still, does not look fine enough for espresso.
qAndA.answer: Hi, I grounded black pepper yesterday. The grind is pretty fine (grounded for 20 sec.), happy with the result. It should work for espresso too. Hope this helps.

qAndA.question: How many times do you have to fill it to grind a standard bag (about 13oz) of beans?
qAndA.answer: The cap holds maybe 1/2 cup of beans, some like fresh ground coffee + do small batches, this may/may not work for you, depending on the quantity of grounds you want, whether you do it daily or on occasion. Some larger pieces remained unground

qAndA.question: Does it support 220v?
qAndA.answer: No

qAndA.question: Can this b used to gring a course gring veg/flower natural fertilizer to make it more fine so it dissolves in water better?
qAndA.answer: likely yes, if not too sinewy

qAndA.question: What is the capacity of grinding container?
qAndA.answer: No idea, I put 4 big spoon and still have more space
